Su familia esta conformada por sus tres hijas (uno, seis y 14 años de edad) y su propósito es que sean igual o mejor que ella en los negocios.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar granos básicos y productos lácteos, los cuales se venden rápidamente. En ese sentido manifiesta que esta bien, ya que por vivir en la zona urbana, ahí mismo llegan los distribuidores a surtirle el negocio, lo cual le facilita desarrollar sus actividades y mantener siempre los productos disponibles a  los clientes.


Ella tiene proyecciones a futuro, pero con recursos propios no puede realizarlos, con el financiamiento podrá ser más competitiva, al disponer de todo lo que necesitan sus clientes.  

La señora Quenia manifiesta que su esfuerzo, es para ver crecer a su familia, dar un buen ejemplo para que en el futuro tener un negocio bien fortalecido el cual sea fuente de ingresos para todos.
texts.en:
Quenia, 34, says that is it because she lived in an area driven by commerce that she became interested in business from a young age. Despite being young, she currently owns a well-established store. Her family is made up of three daughters (aged 1, 6 and 14 years old) and her aim is to be equal to or even better than her in business.

The loan that she is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy bulk grains and dairy products which sell quickly. In this sense, she asserts that the business is going well as given that she lives in an urban area, and that distributers are even able to stock the business directly which facilitates the development of her activities and always have products available for her customers.

Quenia has projects for the future, but cannot achieve them with her own resources. With the loan, however, she will be able to be more competitive, to have everything her customers need.

Quenia says that her efforts go into seeing her family grow, giving a good example so that in the future she will have a strengthened business with which it will be a source of income for all.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains and dairy products which sell quickly.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: Julia socia del grupo “Las Azucenas” conformada por 08 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables. Julia de  46 años casada con 07 hijos 05 de ellos aún dependientes. Actualmente se dedica al tejido de chompas, chalinas, guantes y colchas la cual lo realiza a pedidos. Comenzó con esta actividad hace 20 años, fruto de su esfuerzo ha podido comprarse 02 máquinas de coser la cual le facilita realizar sus tejidos. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicito el crédito para la compra de materiales como hilos y lanas en mayor cantidad. Su mayor deseo es de comprarse otra máquina de coser. Julia junto al grupo “Las Azucenas” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso. Julia está ubicada en la parte posterior, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa color azul.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Las Azucenas” group made up of eight responsible and enterprising women. Julia, 46, is married and has seven children, five of whom are still dependent. She currently makes her living producing sweaters, scarves, gloves and bedspreads which she makes to order. She started this activity 20 years ago, and the fruit of her labor was the purchase of two sewing machines which facilitates the sewing process. 

With the aim of continuing to improve, Julia is seeking the loan to buy materials such as threads and wool in a larger quantity. Her greatest dream is to buy another sewing machine. 

Julia, along with the "Las Azucenas" group, is grateful for the loan given as it makes her progress possible. Julia is in the rear row, the first on the left and is wearing a blue sweater.

loans.use: to buy thread and wool.

loans.name: Pierrette's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pierrette est âgée de 50 ans et est une veuve. Pierrette a deux enfants qui sont tous à sa charge. Pierrette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Pierrette vend des produits divers (pâtes alimentaires, biscuits, sucre, etc.) à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants. Pierrette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: This is a group of three people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, whose name is Pierrette, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 50 years old and a widow. She has two children who are in her care. Pierrette did not attend school. In order to cover her various expenses, she sells diverse products (pasta, biscuits, sugar, etc. from her home. This activity enables her to provide for her children's needs without any great difficulty. She gets her supplies from a Benin market. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover and income, Pierrette is, together with the other members of her group, requesting a first loan from Alidé. This will enable them to expand their businesses and increase their customer bases and income.

loans.use: to buy various products (pasta, biscuits, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es una persona honrada y trabajadora, vive en casa propia con sus padres y sus dos  hijos, hace varios años se dedica a la venta de bebidas como: gaseosas, jugos, agua, etc.  tiene mucha clientela pues es un producto muy vendible y ellas es muy amable a la hora de atender a sus clientes, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para la compra de mas bebidas por mayor y con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client is an honorable and hardworking person. She lives in her own home with her parents and two children. For some years, she has worked selling drinks such as sodas, juices, water, etc. She has many customers as she has a very salable product and she is very friendly when serving customers. With what she makes from the business, she is able to cover some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more drinks wholesale and with this she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy drinks wholesale such as sodas, juices, water, etc.

loans.name: Los Valientes Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS VALIENTES está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Matilde, en la foto la de la chompa azul y blusa blanca tiene 33 años y tiene  tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en restaurante que se encuentra en la zona de los lotes de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Matilde va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para la ampliación de su restaurante y así  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Matilde va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una cadena de restaurantes y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela, la Sra. Matilde es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: The entrepreneurship bank Los Valientes is comprised of 8 members: 7 women and 1 man. The president of the bank is Matilde. In the photo she is wearing the blue top and white shirt. She is 33 years old and has 3 children. She works selling food in a restaurant that can be found in the Los Lotes area of the city of Santa Cruz. This loan is her first with this institution. Matilde will use the loan to buy tables and chairs to grow her restaurant and, in they way, she will offer her customers greater comfort. Her reason for requesting the loan is to keep improving her business. Matilde will use the results to keep buying supplies and increase her income. Her wish for her business is to have a chain of restaurants so she can offer a better service to her customers. Matilde is a very hardworking person who feels happy because of the opportunity offered to her.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to grow their business

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Silvia de 30 años de edad, es una persona responsable y honrada, vive en casa propia con su esposo y  sus dos hijos ellos estudian actualmente, hace tres años se dedica  a la venta de mariscos en su casa de habitación y lo fines de semana lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Silvia solicita un crédito para la compra de mariscos por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, con esto espera obtener mejores ganancias y  brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Silvia is 30 years old. She is a responsible and honorable person who lives in her own home with her husband and their 2 children who are currently in school. 3 years ago, she began selling seafood from her home and, at the weekend, she travels to sell in different settlements and markets near to where she lives. With what she makes from her business, she is able to cover some of the household expenses. Silvia is requesting a loan to buy seafood wholesale to be able to continue her business as this is her only source of income. With this, she hopes to make better profits and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seafood wholesale.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es: Doña Silvia de 31 años de edad,  es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta, es madre soltera vive en casa de unos familiares con sus dos hijos  de 16 y 7 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, hace cuatro años se dedica a la venta de pollos en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos por mayor para  satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, con esto espera obtener mejores ganancias para  brindarle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Silvia is 31 years old and is a hardworking and honest person. She is a single mother and lives in the home of some relatives with her 2 children who are 16 and 7 years old and who are currently studying. 4 years ago, she began selling chickens in the market which is close to her place of residence. With what she makes from her business, she can cover some of the household expenses. Silvia is requesting a loan to buy chickens wholesale to satisfy the needs of her customers. With this, she hopes to make better profits in order to offer her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy chickens wholesale

loans.name: Veronica  Beatriz

texts.es: Doña Verónica de 33 años de edad es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos ellos estudian actualmente, hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Verónica solicita un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor  para poder seguir con su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias y con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Verónica is 33 years old and is a very responsible and hardworking person. She lives in her own home with her life partner and their 2 children who are currently in school. 8 years ago, she began selling fruits and vegetables. With what she makes from her business, she is able to cover some of the household expenses. Verónica is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale to be able to continue with her business and make better profits. With this, she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Yeny Carolina

texts.es: Doña Yeny  de 30 años de edad es una persona responsable y honrada, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, hace tres años se dedica  a la venta de mariscos lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Yeny esta solicitando un prestamo para la compra de mariscos por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, con esto espera obtener mejores ganancias y  brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yeny, 30, is a responsible and honest person.  She lives in her own house with her husband and two children, ages 11 and 6, who attend school.

Yeny has sold shellfish for three years as a street vendor around the different communities and in markets near her home.  She's able to pay for some of her household expenses with what she earns.

Yeny's requesting a loan to buy shellfish wholesale so she can continue with her business, which is her only source of income.

She hopes to earn better profits and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shellfish wholesale

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is married, and she has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Norma has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy another fishing net for her business.

Norma has been in this business for 17 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy another fishing net for her business

loans.name: Hilda Ofelia

texts.es: La Sra. Hilda tiene 30 años, ella se dedica a la realización de trabajos decorativos de manera manual y tambien utiliza una maquina cortadora y de coser, ya que esta es precisamente su actividad es el  Arte decorativo, tiene una tienda que se encuentra en la zona central donde expone la variedad de sus productos. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene dentro de la institución, la Sra. Hilda utilizara este préstamo para compra de material para realizar sus artesanías ya que tiene un trabajo de decoración de una actividad social,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para tener el material adecuado y de calidad para los trabajos, la Sra. Hilda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar la venta de sus productos en el mercado y utilizara los beneficios en el incremento de ingresos para su negocio, su deseo es comprarse una casa propia, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por su apoyo ya que  le permite crecer en su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda, 30, earns a living making decorations by hand.  She also uses cutting and sewing machines.  Her job is decorative art.  She has a store in the downtown area where she shows the variety of her products.

This is Hilda's first loan with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy material to make her handicrafts because she has a job decorating for a social activity.  She's requesting the loan so she has enough quality material to do the job.

The challenge Hilda faces is increasing her sales in the market.  She'll use the profits to increase her income for the business.

Hilda wants to buy her own house.  She's happy and feels grateful to the institution for the support, which allows her to grow in her business and improve her income and, as a result, her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy material to make decorations

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel  de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia, junto a su compañera de vida y su  hija, el se dedica al cultivo de maicillo y al ganado desde hace varios años, es una persona responsable, honesta, trabajadora, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Don Miguel solicita un crédito para continuar con el cultivo de maicillo y comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes etc. y para el ganando comprar vitaminas y concentrado ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel, 40, lives in his own house with his life partner and his daughter.

Miguel has made a living growing sorghum and raising cattle for several years.  He's a responsible, honest, and hardworking person.  Thanks to his job he has been able to pay many of his household expenses.

Miguel's requesting a loan to continue growing sorghum and to buy seeds, soil amendments, fertilizer, etc.  He'll also buy vitamins and concentrated feed for the cattle.

This is Miguel's only source of income and he'll be able to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, soil amendments, fertilizer, vitamins, and concentrated feed

loans.name: 06.07.6 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lê has a retail business selling rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for reselling.
 
Lê is 40 years old, and she is married, with three children.  Lê is the group leader of the 06.07.6 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of four members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Her children are grown up.

This is Lê's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Lê has been involved in her business for six  years.  The main hardship that Lê faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lê hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase rice for reselling

loans.name: Sidonie's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Sidonie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans. Sidonie est mariée à un frigoriste nommé Alexis. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sidonie assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Sidonie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour contribuer aux diverses charges du ménage, Sidonie vend des produits vivriers à son domicile. Sidonie exerce cette activité depuis dix ans. Sidonie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Sidonie et son groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people, who live in the same area. The representative of the group, Sidonie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 46 years old. She is married to a refrigeration specialist named Alexis. The couple has three children, who all go to school and are still under their care. Sidonie and her husband together take care of the household expenses. Sidonie did not go to school.

To support the household expenses, Sidonie sells foodstuffs from her home. She has been doing this for the past ten years. She procures her goods from a market in Benin.

This is the first time that Sidonie and her group has asked for financial support from Alide, in order to ease their cash-flow and strengthen their business so they can better respond to their customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Fruits 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FRUITS 2 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Bernadette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Bernadette est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à Abel, un menuisier. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Bernadette et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Bernadette n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis neuf ans, Bernadette vend des recharges téléphoniques, de la farine de manioc et divers autres produits dans une ville du Bénin. Bernadette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet d'assurer les besoins de sa famille sans grande difficulté. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Bernadette n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Bernadette et les autres membres du groupe FRUITS 2 sollicitent ensemble un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Fruits 2 group is made up of three people who are friends living in the same area of Benin. The representative of the group is named Bernadette and she has her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time that this group has asked for financial support from Alide to help them raise the level of their business.

Bernadette is 35 years old and is married to Abel, a carpenter. The couple has three children, all of whom go to school and are under their care. Bernadette and her husband live with their children and together they are responsible for the various household expenses. Bernadette did not go to school.

For the last nine years, Bernadette has been selling prepaid phone cards, cassava flour, and other goods in a town in Benin. Bernadette procures her goods from a Benin market. This business allows her to take care of her family's needs without much difficulty. Because of her limited means, Bernadette can no longer meet the increasing demands of her customers. 

For this reason and their limited resources, she and the other members of the Fruits 2 group are seeking a loan with Alide.

loans.use: to buy prepaid phone cards, cassava flour, etc.

loans.name: Okpe Oluwa 1 Group

texts.fr: OKPE OLUWA 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Odette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un soudeur nommé Anicet. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Odette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Odette n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Odette vend des condiments et divers autres produits à son domicile. Odette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Odette et les autres membres du groupe OKPE OLUWA 1 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Okpe Oluwa 1 is a group of three people, who all live in the same area of Benin. The representative of the group, Odette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 40 years old and is marred to a welder named Anicet. The couple has four children, who all go to school and are still under their care. Odette lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple supports their various household expenses. Odette did not go to school.

For the last twenty or so years, Odette has been selling condiments and other products from her home. Odette procures her goods from a market in Benin. 

This is the fourth time that Odette and the other members of the Okpe Oluwa 1 group have asked for financial support from Alide, in order to ease their cash flow and strengthen business so they can better meet the needs of their customers. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy condiments, etc

loans.name: Odette Akouavi's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Odette Akouavi. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Âgée de 35 ans, Odette Akouavi est mariée à un coiffeur du nom de Clément. Le couple a deux enfants, tous à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Odette Akouavi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs huit ans, Odette Akouavi mène comme activité la vente de « Moyo » (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs accompagné de sauce de tomate aux poissons) dans une ville du Bénin. Odette Akouavi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Odette Akouavi et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people, whose representative is named Odette Akouavi (whose hand is raised in the photograph). The members of the group live in the same area. In order to ease their cash flow, this group is seeking for the first time a loan with Alide. 

Odette Akouavi is 35 years old and is married to a hairdresser named Clement. The couple has two children, who are both under their care. The family lives together. The couple together supports the various family expenses. Odette Akouavi did not go to school.

For about the past eight years, Odette Akouavi has been selling Moyo (a local food made with a base of cornstarch accompanied with tomato sauce with fish) in a town in Benin. She procures her goods from a market in Benin.

This first loan will certainly allow Odette Akouavi and her group to increase the level of their business, the number of customers, and their earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn and vegetable oil

loans.name: Ma. Regine

texts.en:
This is Ma. Regine, a 38-year-old resident of Malipay, Pasay, Philippines. Married to Dioniso, a security guard, and a mother to their children, she and her husband manage their household while operating the business, working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.


Ma. Regine sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct-selling brands such as Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, etc. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and that difference accounts for the profits that dealers make upon their sales. Ma. Regine's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week.


To help her continue operations of her business, Ma. Regine is requesting a Php8,000 loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, etc. needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her operation.  


Ma. Regine hopes that her business will expand, and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Rodily

texts.en:
Rodily is 29 years old and married. She has two children.

Rodily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. 

Rodily requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, eggs, coffee, etc. Rodily has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rodily aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, eggs, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Fruits Group

texts.fr: FRUITS est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Bernadette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un plombier du nom de Luc. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Bernadette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis dix ans, Bernadette vend des condiments et divers produits dans un marché du Bénin. Bernadette achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la première fois que  Bernadette et les autres membres du groupe FRUITS sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Fruits is a group of three people, who all live in the same area. The representative of the group, Bernadette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 35 years old and is married to a plumber named Luc. The couple has two children, who both go to school and are under their care. Bernadette lives with her husband and children. The couple together supports their various household expenses.

For the past ten years, Bernadette has been selling condiments and other goods in a market in Benin. She buys her goods in Benin. 

This is the first time that Bernadette and the other members of the Fruits group are seeking financial support from Alide, so that they can ease their cash flow, strengthen their business, and better respond to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy condiments and other goods

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim is 21 years old. She lives with her spouse and a child in the small village of Baray district, Kampong Thom province. She has been involved in the agricultural business from an early age as her parents were farmers and taught her how to handle this business. This is a traditional activity for the family. She now works hard on her own land, which she inherited after she married, growing rice and cassavas for a seasonal income.

Due to the lack of economic resources for an investment into her farming project, she has applied for a loan in the sum of KHR 4,000,000, which enables her to pay laborers for transplanting rice and weeding the cassava plantation. As a result of the loan support, she hopes to maintain her crops in good condition and ensure a fruitful harvest in this coming season. This will improve the income for her family. She thanks lenders for a constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay laborers for transplanting rice and weeding the cassava plantation.

loans.name: 12-05-01 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Liên is 37 years old and she is married and has two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

Liên is the group leader of the 12-05-01 Quảng Tâm solidarity group, which consists of eight members. 

She has a retail business selling general things. Liên has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Liên is applying for a loan to purchase general things to resell such as candy, sugar, milk, soap, etc. 

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase items for reselling, such as candy, sugar, milk and soap.

loans.name: Evelyn Xiomara

texts.es:
Doña Evelyn tiene 43 años de edad es agricultora y ama de casa madre de 2 hijos los cuales están en la escuela en diferentes grados de educación. Su esposo murió hace un tiempo por lo que a ella le es más difícil y cansado poder atender muchas de las necesidades de sus hijos pero ella considera no son imposibles. Ella solo pudo cursar hasta tercer grado ya que el apoyo por parte de sus padres en su juventud no era el mejor siendo la economía de ellos regular la cual solo podían cubrir los gastos del hogar pero agradece el esfuerzo que ellos hicieron para que ella pudiese estudiar. Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene una pequeña parcela de tierra cultivada con café lo cual aprendió desde muy pequeña gracias a sus padres ya que ellos son agricultores por generación y tradición. Su mayor desafío no es la competencia sino una excelente producción y cultivo de café al momento de la cosecha y poder generar ingresos para su familia y hogar.

Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual dará un mejor y mayor asistencia a sus cultivos de café comprando 14 QQ de formula cafetalera, 8 QQ de fórmula de crecimiento, 12 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0 y 9 QQ de urea. Sus metas y planes a futuro son los de seguir comprando más tierra mientras tenga fuerzas, cultivando más café y poco a poco ir formando el patrimonio para que sus hijos tengan una tierra donde trabajar, donde construir sus hogares y enfrentar los problemas económicos de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Evelyn is forty-three years old, and is a farmer and homemaker.  She is also the mother of two children, and they are both in school and studying in different grades.  Her husband died a while ago, which has made it more difficult and tiring, yet not impossible, to be able to give her children everything that they need.  

Evelyn could only study until the third grade.  The support she received from her parents during her youth was not the best, and her parents' financial situation allowed them to cover only the home expenses.  However, she is grateful to them for their efforts to ensure that she could at least begin her studies.

She makes a living performing domestic chores, and she also has a small parcel of land where she cultivates her coffee crops.  She learned this practice when she was very young, thanks to her parents who were farmers.  Her family members are farmers through generation and tradition.  Evelyn's greatest challenge is not the competition she faces, but the need for an excellent production and coffee crop at the moment of the harvest.  This allows her to be able to generate an income for her family and home.

Today, she is requesting financing so that she is able to give better and greater maintenance to her coffee crops.  She will buy 14 quintals of a specialized coffee fertilizer, 8 quintals of growth fertilizer, 12 quintals of a specific 18-46-0 formula fertilizer, and 9 quintals of urea.  

Her goals and plans for the future are to buy more land while she can, cultivate more coffee, and little by little, build up the inheritance so that her children have land where they can work, build their homes, and face economic difficulties in a favorable manner.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mekar Sandat Group

texts.en:
The Mekar Sandat group choose a new head, Ni Komang. With 12 members left, the group will use their new loan to increase the population of pigs, renovate the cages and buy feed.
 
Ni Komang has two children. The older is married and the second child is still in junior high school. Her husband works as a labourer. She will use her loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed. She plans to use all the profit to support her children's education. She wants her children to have a better life in the future.

On the disbursement, one member could not attend because she was attending a religious ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Rosa Elba

texts.es: Doña rosa de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su  esposo y sus dos hijo de 9 y 4 años de edad , ella se dedica a la venta de verduras desde 1 año,  ella va solventando algunas de las necesidades del hogar  con lo que obtiene de su trabajo, es una persona muy trabajadora , responsable y  amable con sus clientes  es por esa razón que tiene una gran clientela , doña rosa está solicitando un crédito para  poder invertir  en la compra de verduras por mayor como: cebollas, tomates, papas,  etc. y tener más variedad y mejores sus ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is thirty-three years old and lives in her own house together with her husband and two children, ages 9 and 4.  She has made a living selling vegetables for one year, and has been able to pay for some home necessities with the money she makes from her work.  She is very hardworking, responsible, and kind with her customers.  For this reason, she has a large customer base.

Rosa is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables wholesale.  She will buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes, etc. and have more variety.  She will be able to earn a better income and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale, like onions, tomatoes, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: 12-06-03 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Thúy is 39 years old and she is married. She has three children. Thúy supports three dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province

She has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. Thúy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital. Thúy is applying for a loan to purchase a sewing machine to do clothes-sewing services. 

She is the leader of a five-member group, the 12-06-03 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Marichelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marichelle works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Marichelle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of items to sell in her store, such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, and noodles.

Marichelle has been sustaining her business activities through her six previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Alou

texts.fr:
Agé de 30 ans, il a une épouse, est père de 4 enfants et  est domicilié  avec sa famille dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Mr Alou est enseignant dans une école privée à Koutiala, et en plus de cette activité, il mène des activités de commerce, il est propriétaire d’une boutique de divers et d’une boulangerie. Ces activités lui procurent assez de revenus et  sa demande est très grande, car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité,  Alou a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il  est à son  3ème prêt   individuel. Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition d’un grand stock de farine de blé. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et souvent à Koutiala. Monsieur Alou espère réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA, qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Alou is 30 years old, has a wife, and is the father of 4 children. He lives with his family in the city of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region.) He is a teacher in a private school in Koutiala, and in addition to this work, he runs the businesses of owning a small shop that sells various items, and operating a bakery. These businesses earn him a fair amount of revenue and the demand for him is quite large, as he receives many customers every day.

In order to meet the needs of his customers and to grow his business, Alou turned to the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his third loan. He will use this loan to acquire a large stock of wheat flour. He stocks up in Bamako and often in Koutiala. Alou hopes to earn a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA, which he will use to repay the interest to Soro, meet the needs of his family, and reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of wheat flour

loans.name: 12-01-08 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Nga works in agriculture. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of her most critical business difficulties is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and then resell in the future.

Nga is 52 years old, and she is married with 3 adult children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 12-01-08 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. 

In the future, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to travel within the country for vacation.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 34 years old and married with four children who are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn has been farming rice for 4 years and also earns additional income by making nipa roofing. 

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Saroeb's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Ek Phnom district of Cambodia, Saroeb is 37 years old and married with three children, one of whom who is in school while another two are still small.  She and her husband are hard-working farmers who earn a living by farming rice and cucumbers. Saroeb can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Saroeb has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two loan cycles and successfully paid back her previous loans. The loans from VisionFund have helped to support the family’s business. As the leader of a two-person group, Saroeb will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ives Andre

texts.fr: Ives André est un jeune homme de 24 ans célibataire sans enfant mais ayant  à sa charge une personne.il est commerçant dans un marché  de la capitale depuis 8 ans où il vend  la fripperie dans une petite boutique.il va chaque jour au marché et  achète des vêtements en détail chez ceux qui en ont des ballots tout ceci est dû à la petitesse de son capital qui l'empêche de s'approvisionner en gros, ce qui crée à long terme la baisse de sa clientèle  .Ce credit l'aidera  à acheter un ballot de vêtements ce qui lui  permettra de conserver et d'augmenter sa clientele,donc ses ventes et par conséquent son bénéfice.bénéfice qui l'aidera d'une part  à reinvestir dans le but d'agrandir sa petite boutique  et d'autre part de faire face à ses multiples dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ives André is a young 24-year-old single man. He doesn't have any children but he does have one person in his care. He has been a trader in the market of the capital for eight years where he sells second-hand clothing from a small stall. He goes to the market every day and buys clothes on a retail basis from other traders who deal in bundles. This is due to his low business capital which prevents him from buying wholesale and has led to the decline of his customer base over time.

THis loan will help him to buy a bundle of clothes that will enable him to maintain and enlarge his customer base. As a result he will be able to increase his sales and also his profits. This will help him on the one hand to invest in his goal of enlarging his small stall and on the other hand enable him to cover his numerous daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
This is Ma. Ana, 38, a resident of Malibay Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, her business partner and the father of her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Ma. Ana operates a food stall. She sells fresh-cooked noodles and other street food staples. She also sells charcoal to earn additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Ma. Ana is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more raw products and supplies for her business. 

Ma. Ana hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase raw products and supplies.

loans.name: 12-05-05 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mai is 41 years old and she is married and has two children. Mai supports one dependent with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. The other child is grown up.

Mai operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. Mai has been involved in this business for seven years. The  main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is the leader of a four-member group, the 12-05-05 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. This is Mai's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Mai hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
This is Quirina, 52, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Nardino, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Quirina manages her sidecar transportation business. She has one unit of sidecar or bicycle cart that carries up to two passengers to their destination within the community. Her regular customers are workers, students and employees in the community. She also has a buy and sell business for additional income. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan for the maintenance of her sidecar.

Quirina dreams that her business will flourish and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her sidecar.

loans.name: Florda

texts.en:
Florda is 40 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ambulant vending stall where she sells household goods. Florda has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell, like coffee, sugar, soy sauce, milk, and vinegar.

Florda has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her business for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Florda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of merchandise

loans.name: Juana Rafaela

texts.es: Doña Juana es originaria de la ciudad de León. De 53 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida desde hace tiempo. Inicio esta actividad  con el apoyo de su familia, poco a poco con mucho  esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado salir a delante. Comercializa sus productos en su casa. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, frijoles, aceite, verduras, platos entre otros con el fin de ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de platillos. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas y obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana, 53, is from the city of León.  She's married and the mother of four children.

Juana's a merchant by trade and has worked for some time preparing and selling food.  She started this activity with the support of her family.  She has managed to get ahead little by little with a lot of effort and dedication.  She sells her products at home.

Juana's requesting the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, vegetables, plates, and other things so she can offer her customers a variety of dishes.  She thinks the loan will be a big help to her because she'll increase her sales and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, vegetables, and plates

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 45 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Liza has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Liza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rubylyn

texts.en:
This is Rubylyn. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, household, and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rubylyn dreams to become more successful and hopes to give her children a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory

loans.name: 12-05-04 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 42 years old and she is married and has three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant, selling vegetables. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables for reselling. Hoa is the group leader of the 12-05-04 Quảng Tâm solidarity group, which consists of four members. This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation internationally.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for reselling.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 38 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn has been farming rice for 2 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Marilyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who farms rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers.

She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers

loans.name: Loselyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children who are in school, Loselyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming rice in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming and selling vegetables. Loselyn is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries in cleaning the field and to buy fertilizers for her business.

Loselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Solida's Group

texts.en:
Solida, 23, lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is married and has two children who are both in school. The family’s main sources of income are from her work as a tailor and her husband's work as a taxi driver in the local area. Together, they can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Solida has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her relieve her family's burden and improve their living. To support her business, she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, Solida wants to use her portion to buy more fabrics for her tailoring business. She hopes to earn more income for her family so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ro-Ann

texts.en:
Ro-Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Ro-Ann earns additional income from general store.

Ro-Ann is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy new rice seeds and fertilizers for the next crop for her rice farming business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Ro-Ann dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new rice seeds and fertilizers for the next crop

loans.name: Nge's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of two children, Nge is aged 45 and lives in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. Of her two children, one is still in school. To support her family, Nge and her husband farm rice and raise pigs and chickens. Having been in this business for 11 years, she can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.

Nge is in her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund, while her group member is just with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Nge completely paid back her past loans, which helped her relieve family’s burden. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for another loan. As the leader, Nge wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to buy pig feed. She hopes this loan will enable her increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su familia y su hijo de 6 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura su principal cultivo es el elote, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos de los gastos del hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar todos los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como: fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para seguir con su trabajo y generar mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad económica.
texts.en: The client lives in his own house with his family and his 6 year old son. He is a farmer and his main crop is sweet corn. He sells his products in the markets nearby his residence. With what he earns he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy all of the materials he needs for his crops, such as fertilizer, seeds, pest control, etc. to continue with his work and generate more income to give his family a better financial condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Concesa

texts.en:
This is Concesa, 60, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Rafael and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. Concesa works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Concesa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and reselling them by piece. She also sells rice and frozen foods for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

Concesa is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Concesa hopes to have a bigger store and dreams that her body will always be strong and healthy to do the things that she has to do.  She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and married with five children who are in school. Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, eggs, noodles, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from making nipa roofing. Jocelyn aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Morena works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable selling business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Morena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. Morena hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Eugenio De Jesus

texts.es: Don Eugenio de 36 años de edad  vive en casa propia  con su esposa, su madre y sus dos hijos él es muy trabajador y muy responsable, tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas realiza puertas, balcones, ventanas, polines etc. desde hace 6 años, posee mucha clientela pues realiza un buen trabajo y a un buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos familiares, don Eugenio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hierro, laminas, y las herramientas necesarias para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así podrá darle a su familia una mejor vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Eugenio is 36 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife, his mother and their two children. He is very hardworking and responsible. He has a metalworks workshop where he has made doors, balconies, windows, rods, etc. He has a lot of customers because he does good work at a good price. This is how he earns his money to pay for some household expenses. Eugenio is asking for a loan to buy iron, sheeting, and tools he needs to continue with his business, since this is his only source of work, so that he can give his family a better life with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy iron, sheeting and tools.

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es: Claudia de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en su lugar de residencia y también vende los fines de semana de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Claudia está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder surtir su negoció y así generar mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Claudia is 36 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion and their children. She works selling clothes from her residence and she also sells as a street vendor in the different markets close to her home. With what she earns from her sales she is able to pay for some household expenses. Claudia is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale to be able to stock her business and thus generate more profits and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Mercides

texts.en:
Mercides is 52 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mercides has been farming rice for 18 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Mercides is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and rice seeds. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gilda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Gilda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino de 62, solamente estudio tercer grado, es casado; su esposa también se involucra en los trabajos de la agricultura (siembra de hortalizas), han procreado tres hijos de 10, 8 y 3 años de edad. Tiene una hija solo de él que trabaja en un hotel los hijos de ella son dos y están a cargo de Faustino. Por todo él es padre de 4 hijos.

Él es productor de hortalizas (chile, tomate, huisquil, ejote) tiene alrededor de 14 años de dedicarse a esta actividad del cual obtiene sus ingresos para salir adelante. Aprendió la actividad, porque algunas instituciones llevaban proyectos a la comunidad con el fin de hacer más rentables los cultivos.  Siempre ha sido agricultor, antes solo sembraba maíz y frijol; la parcela donde trabaja esta a un kilómetro de distancia de su casa y se desplaza a pie para llegar al lugar, generalmente,  trabaja todo el día.
   

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar  3 litros de herbicidas, 3 de plaguicidas además, 2 litros de abonos foliares,  2 quintales de formula y pago de 5 personas que le ayudaran a estructurar la tierra donde sembrara. El crédito será una oportunidad para hacer crecer su cultivo, obteniendo así más ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, la necesidad de ir y comprar más baratos y de una vez los insumos agrícolas que necesita.

 Uno de sus sueños es limpiar una parte de su terreno y dejarla apta para establecerle un sistema de riego para en  la época seca sembrar siempre hortalizas y convertirse en un productor potencial  más de lo que hasta hoy es. Ayudara a mitigar la escases de recursos económicos. De las ganancias obtenidas, se proyectara cuanto invertirá en lo sucesivo en el nuevo ciclo del cultivo. De tal  modo que sea una buena inversión, para que al final logre lo que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Faustino is a 62-year-old, married farmer with a third-grade education. His wife also works on the couple's farm (she plants vegetables) and is the mother three of Faustino's four children, who are ages ten, eight, and three. Faustino has another child, an adult daughter who works in a hotel, and her two children also live with Faustino and his wife. The couple's farm is one kilometer from his home, so he can walk there and generally spends all day working at the farm. 

Faustino has grown vegetables (chile, tomatoes, chayote squash, green beans) for the past 14 years and provides for his family with the income from his farm. Faustino has always been a farmer, and he only planted corn and beans until he began to grow a greater variety of crops. Faustino learned to farm because several organizations conducted agricultural programs in his community that were designed to make crops more marketable.  

Faustino is applying for a loan to purchase three liters of herbicide, three liters of insecticide, two liters of foliage manure, and to pay five people who will help him adapt the fields where he plants crops. The loan is an opportunity for Faustino to boost his harvest and his income, which will mean a better quality of life for his family. The loan funds will allow Faustino to purchase the farming supplies he needs all at once and at cheaper prices. 

One of Faustino's ambitions is to adapt part of his farm and make it suitable for installing an irrigation system. Irrigation would allow him to plant crops throughout the dry season and make his farm more productive than it is now. Dry-season planting would alleviate the financial shortfalls that Faustino has experienced. Faustino's income will allow him to plan how much to invest for the next planting season. This loan is thus a smart investment that will allow Faustino to reach his goals.

loans.use: to purchase three liters of herbicides, three liters of insecticide, 2 liters of foliage manure, two quintals of formula, and to pay five people to adapt the fields where he plants crops.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Aged 50 years old, Yorn is a rural villager from the Sangke district who earns a living through farming rice and selling rice soup as her main sources of  income. She has been in this business for 11 years. Yorn has two children, one of whom is still in school.

Yorn has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely paid back her previous loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan, Yorn will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to pay for labor and land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and to sell her crops for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan is age 41 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey District of Battambang Province. She has four children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, she has been in rice farming for 10 years, earning about 28,000 riels (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs.

Phan’s group consists of two members, who are both female. She has been with VisionFund for four cycles, while the other member has been with VisionFund from five to three cycles. She has used her past loan successfully to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Choeurng

texts.en:
Choeurng is a 39-year-old married woman who has seven children, all living in Siem Reap province. She is a farmer and a day laborer. She works all day long to carry out her farm work during the rainy season. Because she has a big family, she collaborates with her husband to be involved in other businesses to provide enough for their family. Also, three of her children are helping them by working as day laborers.

With this new loan, she intends to buy a motorcycle, which will allow her husband to start up a new business by using this motorcycle to transport grocery items for local traders in exchange for money. This profit will enable her husband to generate a daily income and also help cover their day-to-day expenses. She thanks lenders for their constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: 12-01-07 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Chung has a service business providing housing rentals. She has been involved in this business for four years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to build more rooms for renting.

Chung is 32 years old and married with two children. She lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 

Chung is the leader of an eight-member group, the 12-01-07 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

In the future, Chung hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to build more rooms for renting

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Elvira works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  

Elvira is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, chips, bread, coffee, sugar, etc. for her general store business. Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, chips, bread, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
This is Emerita, 61, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is already a widow, and she has children. At her age, she is still working to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Emerita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php12,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Emerita dreams that her business will be more flourishing and hopes that her grandchildren will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Sokha is a 44-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. Pig raising and snack selling have been the only sources of income for her family for four years. Her current business earns her about 28,000 KHR per day. 

Sokha has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan, Sokha will use her portion to buy one more pig for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy one more pig for raising

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
Leap, 46, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married with three children, and she has two children who are still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 10 years, Leap earns about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Leap is in her second cycle as a client with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: 12-05-03 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to resell.

Lan is 47 years old, and she is married with 1 child. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 12-05-03 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, her child is grown up.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Lan hopes for her child to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to resell.

loans.name: 12-03-06 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Thúy is applying for a loan to purchase desks and chairs to support her small food stall. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks.

Thúy is 38 years old and she is married with 3 children. Thúy is the group leader of the 12-03-06 Quảng Tâm solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents

This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thúy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thúy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase desks and chairs to support her small food stall

loans.name: Blas Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Blas vive en casa de un familiar junto a sus hijos, hermana, y sus dos sobrinas, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde  hace varios años, sus ventas son bastante considerables ya que no tiene mucha competencia en el lugar donde comercializa, además su negocio es bastante rentable, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Blas solicita crédito para comprar maíz por mayor y cal  para continuar con la elaboración de tortillas y poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar sus calidad de vida.
texts.en: Blas lives in a relative's house along with her children, a sister and two nieces. She has sold tortillas for the past few years. Her sales are quite good as there is no competition where she sells. Her business is profitable enough. It is how she pays most of the family's expenses. Blas is requesting this loan to buy corn wholesale and lime so she can continue to make tortillas. She wants to be able to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and lime.

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide is 49 years old, and she is married, with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Heide is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.  Heide has been farming rice for two years, and she earns additional income from the direct selling of beauty products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
