texts.es: La clienta vive en casa alquilada, junto a su compañero de vida,  y un hijo, Ella se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, desde hace 2 años, es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y muy comprometida con lo que hace, gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a su familia delante, la clienta solicita un crédito para capital de trabajo, invertir en la compra de mas productos  como papas, aceite, salsas, queso, etc. Y así poder aumentar su nivel de ventas, mejorar sus ganancias y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Cecilia lives in a rented home with her spouse and son. For two years she has made a living selling french fries. She is a very responsible, hard working and committed person in everything that she does. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to move her family forward. 

Cecilia is requesting a loan for working capital to invest in the purchase of more products including potatoes, oil, sauces and cheese. In this way she will be able to improve her sales, increase her earnings and give her family the standard of living that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy more products like potatoes, oil, sauces, and cheese.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Violeta works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and and selling root crops in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from dried coconut meat. Violeta is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell in her business. Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of root crops to sell.

loans.name: Tee

texts.en: Tee is 39 years old, single, and has one child. She runs a small business, selling ice-cakes in her community, as she has been doing for two years. Tee has applied for a loan to buy a freezer, foam cups and cordial. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tee will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, foam cups and cordial for her business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, as she was able to buy more frozen products for her business. She has been in this business for four years. Her business income is helpful with their everyday household expenditures, and also with the education of her children. She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to pay for additional stocks of frozen foods, such as hot dogs, tocino (sweetened cured pork), ham and other products needed in her business. Having more items to sell will result in better profits. Her business profits will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Evangeline hopes that her business will grow, and she dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods, such as hot dogs, tocino (sweetened cured pork) and ham, and other products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta is 47 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child still in school. Crisanta is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Crisanta has been engaged in pig fattening for three years, and she has borrowed from NWTF 10 times in the past to sustain it. In the future, Crisanta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.es:
María de 57 años de edad, es una mujer a la que la vida  le a dado golpes muy duros, a muy corta edad sus padres biológicos la regalaron a personas desconocidas, que ahora son sus padres adoptivos. Ellos fueron  personas muy duras  y decidieron  no darle la oportunidad de estudiar para que se dedicara a los  oficios del hogar.

 A  la edad de 15 años emigro con su familia a la ciudad, lugar que  le permitió trabajar en un taller de artesanías de barro y al que se dedico gran parte de su vida.

Con el tiempo desarrollo una enfermedad  derivada de la elaboración de artesanías, esto la alejo de su única fuente de ingresos. A la edad de 27 años conoció a la persona que seria su esposo de por vida, convivió con él 22 años  y  lastimosamente en el  año 2010 falleció, quedando  en la soledad  ya que no le fue posible procrear hijos.

La única experiencia laboral que tiene son los 10 años en la elaboración de artesanías, fuera de eso solo ha trabajado haciendo oficios domésticos ajenos.

El préstamo será  utilizado  para reparar  el techo de su vivienda que se encuentra en mal estado, comprara materiales de construcción, vara  de castilla , madera, lamina  y teja, todo lo comprará  en ferretería  de la ciudad. 

María, siendo una persona emprendedora, activa y luchadora, tiene como meta personal, aprender a leer y a escribir, para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old. She is a woman who has endured some hard knocks in life. At a very tender age her biological parents gave her to strangers, who are now her adoptive parents. They were very strict with her and decided not to let her study so she could take care of the housework. At 15 she moved with her family to the city, where she started to work in a pottery studio, something she has done most of her life. With time she developed a disease that came from the making of these handicrafts, which separated her from her only source of income. At 27 years of age she met the person who would become her husband. They lived together for 22 years. Unfortunately he passed away in 2010. She was left alone as it was no longer possible to have children. Her only working experience outside of the 10 years of making handicrafts, has been doing domestic work for others. 

The loan will be used to repair the roof of her house which is in poor condition. María will buy castilla rods, wood, metal sheeting and tiles st a hardware store in the city. María being a enterprising, hard-working person who knows how to struggle, has a personal goal. She wants to learn how to read and write so she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house which is in bad shape and to buy construction material like castilla rods (like bamboo), wood, metal sheeting and tiles.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marivic works hard to support her family. She has a rice farming business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. 

Marivic is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She will use the loan to pay salaries for labourers and purchase fertilizers for her rice farming business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay salaries for labourers and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Luzminda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Luzminda has been buying and selling livestock for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to buy a motorcycle to use for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Shella

texts.en: Shella is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Shella is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Shella has been farming rice for three years, and she earns additional income from raising pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 61 years old and married with nine children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Rosenda is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restart his shoe manufacturing business

loans.name: Rosmenda

texts.en:
Rosmenda is 44 years old and hails from the municipality of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children, ages between 6 and 21. Rosmenda is engaged in fishing from their fishpond and in farming to sustain the needs of her children. 

She is asking for a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and floaters.

In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business and to keep and expand it so she can provide for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and floaters.

loans.name: Adán Ignacio

texts.es:
Adán es un hombre casado de 44 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijas y su esposa en el Caserío Coxom, Aldea Argueta, Sololá, Sololá.
El  actualmente es carpintero,  ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura pero por situaciones económicas se decidió por esta actividad, que ha sido bastante productiva en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias. 
Comenta que lleva 22 años en esta labor que le ha ayudado a contribuir en la economía de su familia, por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de materiales de construcción para poder remodelar su vivienda. Este préstamo lo pagara con los ingresos y ganancias que le genera la actividad que realiza.
Su mayor sueño es terminar la remodelación de su vivienda y así poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Adán is a married man, 44 years old, who lives with his 4 daughters and his wife in the settlement of Coxom, township of Argueta, Sololá, Sololá.

He currently works as a carpenter. He previously dedicated himself to agriculture, but because of the economic situation, he decided in favor of this work, which has been quite productive in terms of generating income and earnings. 
 
He comments that he has 22 years of experience with this work, which has helped him contribute to his family's economic support. Currently, he is requesting a loan of Q 5,000.00 to buy construction materials so that he can remodel his home. He will pay off this loan with the income and earnings generated by the work he does. 

His greatest dream is to finish remodeling his home, so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 30 years old and married with three children.

Margie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household items like soap, soft drinks, noodles, egg, sugar, etc.

Margie has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income from buying and selling beauty products.

Margie aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household items like soap, soft drinks, noodles, egg, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Pilar works hard to support her family.

She has a livestock-raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Pilar is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

Pilar has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 35 years old and married with three children ages 9, 10 and 14. She is from Talibon, Bohol. Sandra is engaged in the fishing business for 14 years now. This earns her an average monthly income of 6,000 PHP. She is asking for a loan to buy a new fish net and pay for the repair of her fishing boat.

Sandra hopes that she can make a success out of her business and make it bigger for a better profit. She also wishes that she can avail an educational loan for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new fish net and pay for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Toga

texts.en:
Toga is 24 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community, and has been doing this for one year. 

Toga has requested a loan to buy a kerosene oven, flour, baking soda, sugar and dripping oil. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Toga will buy an electric oven.

loans.use: to buy a kerosene oven, flour, baking soda, sugar and dripping oil for her pancakes business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 38 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leah is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm. Leah has been farming rice for 7 years and also earns additional income from farming/selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is 46 years old and married with two children.

Marlina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items like canned goods, noodles, fabric conditioners, eggs, sugar, etc. to sell in her general store.

Marlina has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming rice and buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Marlina aspires to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items like canned goods, noodles, fabric softeners, eggs, sugar, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 36 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Gina has been pig fattening for 6 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Gina is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a livestock-raising business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock for her livestock-raising business.

Pilar has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Pilar has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving up some money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Rosemarie is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Faleomanu

texts.en: Faleomanu is a 34-year-old woman who lives with her partner and 4 children. She has a small business: sewing. She has many years' experience in this business. Faleomanu needs a loan to buy a hand sewing machine, materials and threads. She will use her profits to improve her business. Faleomanu  joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a hand sewing machine, materials and threads.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 30 years old and from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married, with two children, ages 8 and 10. 

Together with her husband, she farms rice for a living to support their family. She started farming two years ago and found that it really helps augment the income for their needs. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and seedlings to further increase their productivity. 


In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase her businesss's profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seed

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
This is Nelia. She previously obtained a PHP 20,000 loan that she used to buy processed and frozen foods needed in her processing business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 35,000 loan to buy additional processed and frozen foods for her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nelia hopes to have more customers and dreams of a simple and peaceful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of tbeir work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for processed and frozen foods needed to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Ghulam Rasool

texts.en:
Ghulam Rasool is a 43-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father and son; his parents like him a lot due to his caring.

Currently, Ghulam Rasool owns a dairy farm in his town since 1998. He gets milk from buffaloes twice a day, which is very hard work for a single person.  He is growing old and does not have enough energy to perform his tasks as he used to in his young age.
 
Few days ago, one of his cattle was stolen due to lack of security. There is no proper shelter for his cattle, which needs to be improved. 

He wants to buy a buffalo and buildup the shelter but he has insufficient savings, so he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so that he can overcome these deficiencies and carry on his business smoothly.
 
From the profit amount, Ghulam Rasool will ensure the security of his cattle by building up a shelter for them so that he can avoid theft in the future. He wants to appoint an assistant to help him in his daily tasks.
 
Ghulam Rasool is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for getting milk and buildup a secure shelter for his cattle.

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en: Asenati is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years. Asenati has requested a loan to buy a fishing net, canoe ,spears, swim goggles, and a cooler. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Asenati will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, canoe, spears, swim goggles, and a cooler.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She 44 years old and married, with four children, ages 7 to 21. Her husband works as a carpenter to support their family.

Josephine has been engaged in raising hogs for two years now to help augment the income of their household.  She is asking for a loan to buy  two piglets and feed


In the future, she hopes to build a "sari-sari" store, expand her piggery business, and increase her business's profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is a 29-year-old married woman and a loving mother of two children. She has been working in the agriculture sector for nearly five years. Her business activities include preparing the land, transplanting rice, taking good care of her crops and weeding. 

She has to make sure that her crops are in good condition and have a high production at harvest time. Because of insufficient capital to buy enough farm supplies for her crops, Keo has applied for a loan in the sum of 450 US dollars to buy fertilizers and pesticides. 

She expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable her to develop her farm and provide basic necessities for her family. Thanks to lenders for a constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a 60-year-old widow with 9 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

She is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. Sara will use the loan to buy timber, iron roofing, cement, water pipes, nails, a hammer, and bricks.  

Sara joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy timber, iron roofing, cement, water pipes, nails, a hammer, and bricks

loans.name: Guinda

texts.en:
Guinda is from the community of Talibon, Bohol and is 56 years old. She is married with a grown child. Guinda has been rice farming for 13 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides in order to keep her crops from being damaged by pests. She is confident with her farming and with the help of the loan will be able sustain it.

Guinda hopes that she will be more successful and earn a better income so she can build a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
This is Estrella. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used for the repair and maintenance of her rental room. Her earnings were a big help toward their personal, house hold, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for the repair and maintenance of her rental room. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Estrella hopes to expand her business and have more rooms for rent. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week: there, she can draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance of her rental room.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, whose previous loan was a big help in that she was able to buy more gallons of water for her water distribution enterprise. Her profits arsing from the loan also helped both in the education of her children and their everyday household expenditures. Rowena also has a direct selling business as she and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.


Rowena is requesting a new loan for 35,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed in the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.


Rowena dreams of even greater business success and hopes to have their own house and vehicle someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of water for her business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As the married parent of two children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a general store.

 Letecia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell in her business.

Letecia has sustained her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en: Bertha is 22 years old and single with 1 child. She runs a small business selling ice-cakes and pork buns in her community, and has been doing this for 2 years. Bertha has requested a loan to buy flour, soy sauce, oil, onions, sugar, tangs, foam cups, cordials and dripping oil. She joined SPBD in 2000 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Bertha will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, soy sauce, oil, onions, sugar, tangs, foam cups, cordials, and dripping oil.

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en: Toafa is 39 years old and married with 1 child. She makes and sells elei materials, used for the traditional Samoan method of printing fabrics, to earn a living and has been doing this for 1 year. Toafa has requested a loan to buy materials, paints, brushes, and stencils designs. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and able to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, paints, brushes, and stencils designs.

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en:
Madonna is 49 years old and married, with seven children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Madonna is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Madonna has been raising pigs for 15 years, and she also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a direct-selling Avon products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more Avon products to sell to her customers.

Nena has been in this business for five years.  She also earns income from a general store.

Nena has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es: Aura es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Tiene 41 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de comida, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hija mayor quienes les ayudan con la comercialización de dichos alimentos. Su expectativa es brindar un servicio de calidad y adquirir mayor clientela. Solicita el crédito para comprar: repollo, tomate, vinagre, sal, carne, pollo, platos y vasos con el fin de cumplir las necesidades de sus clientes.Estima que el credito sera de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos. Su plan futuro es expandir su negocio. su meta próxima es implementar nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Aura is from the city of Granada. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She is a vendor by trade and works making and selling food. She has the help of her husband and eldest daughter who help her sell the food. 

Her hope is to offer quality service and acquire a larger clientele. She is requesting a loan to buy: cabbage, tomatoes, vinegar, salt, meat, chicken, plates and glasses, in order to meet her customer's needs. 

She thinks that the loan will be a great help, as she will increase her sales and obtain greater income. Her future plan is to expand her business. Her next goal is to introduce new dishes.

loans.use: To buy cabbage, tomatoes, vinegar, salt, meat, chicken, plates and glasses.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 35 years old and married, with three children, two of whom in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Karen runs a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell.  She has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Karen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 41 years old and married. With three children currently in school, Nimfa works very hard to provide for them.

Nimfa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Nimfa has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as fabric conditioner, shampoo, canned goods, candies, snack foods, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Nimfa would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Allah Rakha

texts.en:
Allah Rakha is a 43-year-old married man, living along with 5 children in the area of Lahore Pakistan.  He is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.
For many years he has been successfully running a milk selling business in his locality.  Over time, he has become famous in his area for providing good quality milk.  He also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra profit.  He has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to his family's income.  His business is good enough for him to lead a decent life. 
For the growth of business he wants to buy a buffalo to produce more milk to sell but he does not have enough money to buy a buffalo.  Therefore, Allah Rakha requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he could buy a buffalo for producing milk. 
He hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, butter and cheese which ultimately will help him to generate more cash.
Allah Rakha says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for producing milk.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 44 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Anselma runs a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more dried coconut to sell.

Anselma has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Anselma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried coconut to sell

loans.name: Maria Erika Vanessa

texts.es:
María de 25 años de edad, vive actualmente con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 8, 4 y 2 años de edad y un último de 5 meses. Es una  joven emprendedora que con su esposo trabajan la tierra, compartiendo la carga laboral para asegurar el alimento por el resto del año.

Desde que tenía 12 años ella era la encargada de llevarle los alimentos al papá, al lugar donde él cultivaba granos básicos, maíz, frijol y maicillo. Desde entonces a adquirido la experiencia para trabajar.

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de insumos agrícolas semillas, fertilizantes y agroquímicos, para levantar el cultivo y así obtener una buena cosecha de grano.

María tiene una meta, enviar a sus hijos a una escuela más cerca de donde viven, ya que actualmente se desplazan demasiado lejos para tener acceso a la educación y corren demasiados riesgos, en época lluviosa  y con la delincuencia.
texts.en:
María is 25 years old and currently lives with her husband and their four children, ages 8, 4, 2 and the youngest, five months. She is an enterprising young woman who works the land with her husband, sharing the work burden to ensure food for the rest of the year. 

From the age of 12 she was the one responsible for taking food to her father, to the place where he was growing basic staples such as corn, beans and sorghum. Since then she has acquired the experience to do the work. 

The loan will be used to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and agrochemicals to raise the crop and this way obtain a good harvest. Maria has a goal: to send her children to a school closer to where they live, as currently they travel too far to have access to education, and run too many risks in the rainy season and with crime.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, seeds, fertilizers and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: San

texts.en: San is 25 years old and married with three children.  She lives with her family in Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham province.  She earns a living by farming rice, but the land she owns for farming is not big enough to provide security for the entire family.  So, she and her husband are seeking another business opportunity to support their living costs.  To make her dream a reality, she needs a capital investment to start up a traveling sales business.  She has applied for a loan amounting to KHR 1,200,000 to buy a used motorcycle and a variety of breads to sell from this motorcycle.  Through this investment as a result of the loan, she hopes to earn additional income to cover her day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle and a variety of breads to sell from this motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria de 41 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella tiene una farmacia en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela ya que es la única persona que posee una farmacia en la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos familiares, Maria está solicitando un préstamo para comprar más medicamentos por mayor para abastecer su negocio y tener mas ganancias para darle a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria, 41 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her two children, who are 11 and 9 years old. They are currently in school. 
She has had a pharmacy in her home for several years. She has a large customer base because she is the only person with a pharmacy in the area. With what she earns from her sales, she is able to cover some household expenses. 
Maria is requesting a loan to buy more medicines at wholesale to stock her business and make more money so she can offer her children more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more medicine at wholesale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr: Âgée  de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants MARIAM  vit  avec son mari, sa coépouse et  leurs enfants  dans  la ville de Koutiala. Mme n’as pas eu la chance de faire des études,  raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis à bas âge qu’elle apprit auprès de sa maman. Son activité est basée sur les produits saisonniers, actuellement  elle effectue l’achat vente d’arachide au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle trouve que cette activité est rentable et que ça marche bien en cette période. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, MARIAM a fait recours  à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 8 ans.   Elle a pris plusieurs prêts dans l’association (prêt solidaire) tous  remboursés correctement  et elle est à son 4ème  prêt individuel dont les précédents ont été bien remboursés. Avec ce financement, MARIAM compte acheter  20 sacs d’arachide pour les vendre en détail et au comptant au grand marché. Avec ce financement, elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement des d’intérêts de Soro, contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: 56 years old, married and the mother of six, Mariam lives with her husband, her husband’s other wife and their children in the town of Koutiala. Mariam did not have the opportunity to study, which is why she started earning a living early on, learning from her mother. Her business depends on the products in season; at present she busy and resells peanuts at the main market of Koutiala. She finds that this business is profitable and  going well during this part of the year. In order to bolster her working capital and expand her business, Mariam has been relying on the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution for eight years. She has taken out multiple loans from Soro Yiriwaso (solidarity loans), all duly repaid. Now she is on her fourth individual loan, having repaid her prior loans well. With this financing, Mariam plans to buy 20 bags of peanuts in order to sell them retail, for cash, at the main market. Thanks to this loan, she hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 75,000 West African francs, which she plans to use to pay off her interest to Soro and help improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of peanuts.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 28 años, es un joven que estudio solamente 6to grado, actualmente está soltero, la persona con quien se acompaño y procreo un hijo se separo de él. Tiene un hijo de  8 años de edad que esta estudiando segundo grado, con él vive su mamá quien desde que se separo de su padre vive con él.

 Él vende hamburguesas, panes con pollo, papitas con queso, sodas. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a esta actividad, pues es la fuente de ingresos más viable que ha podido encontrar hasta hoy. Aprendió este trabajo por iniciativa propia, porque desde pequeño le llamo la atención  ser comerciante. Sale a ofrecer sus productos a los vecinos del lugar,  para ello se moviliza a pie, a preparar la venta le ayuda su madre. Generalmente, sale a vender por las tardes, y los días domingos lo hace en la cancha hasta  que terminan las actividades deportivas.

El financiamiento será utilizado, para comprar 3 fardos de sodas,  5 libras de carne para las hamburguesas, 2 quintales de papas, 10 bolsas de pan para las hamburguesas, y con el resto cancelara parte de un crédito que posee con otra institución. Sin el financiamiento, no sería posible comprar la mercadería de una vez, comprando por mayor ahorrara  lo cual ayudara a cubrir otras necesidades de su hogar

 Lo que él ha planificado es ampliar poco a poco su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos, y enseguida hacer la cocina de su casa ya que, actualmente es de bahareque y techo de lamina y no le sirve, fraguar el piso y tener un ambiente más confortable para él y su familia, todo esto lo lograra siendo cuidadoso de sus ingresos; es decir invirtiéndolos en lo que realmente necesita.
texts.en:
Jose is 28 years old and studied to the sixth grade.  He is single, but separated and has an eight year old son who attends second grade.  He lives with his mother who separated from his father.

He sells hamburgers, cheese bread, fried potatoes with cheese, and sodas.  He has been doing this for 10 years and it’s the most viable source of income that he has been able to find to date.  He learned this on his own because he has been interested in being a businessman since he was young.  He goes out to sell his products on foot to his neighbors in the area.  His mother helps him prepare his sales.  He generally goes out to sell in the evenings and on Sundays he works in the sports arena until the games are over. 

He will use the money from this loan to buy three cases of soda, five pounds of hamburger meat, two bushels of potatoes, 10 bags of hamburger buns, and pay off a loan to another institution.  Without this loan, it will not be possible to buy everything at once, in quantity, which will help him cover other needs in her home. 

He has planned to expand little by little, improve his income, and build a kitchen in his home.  The current one is mud with a metal roof and it’s not very good.  He also wants to set the floor so that he and his family can be more comfortable.   He will do all this while being careful about his income, that is to invest it where he really needs to.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, etc.  for her restaurant.

Restituta has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from a general store.

Restituta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, chicken, fish, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Estela Marilyn

texts.es: Doña Estela de 40 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos  hijos que estudia actualmente, ella tiene una pequeña panadería en su lugar de residencia  desde hace varios años, es muy demandada en la zona, es una persona muy amable con sus clientes, además muy dedicada en sus labores,  de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos, Doña Estela solicita crédito para la compra de insumos para elaborar pan como harina, levadura, latas, etc. Para poder continuar con sus negocio, mejorar sus ingresos, y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merece.
texts.en:
Estela is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and kids who are in school. She’s had a small bakery in a residential area for several years. Her goods are in high demand, and Estela is very kind to her clients as well as very dedicated to her work. This is how she’s been able to pay for many household costs. 

Estela is asking for a loan to buy bread-making ingredients like flour, yeast, cans, etc. so that she will be able to continue her business, increase income, and give her family the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread like flour, yeast, cans, etc.

loans.name: Martín Antonio

texts.es:
Don Martín Antonio es un señor de 66 años, originario del municipio de El Sauce, casado, que se dedica a laborar como obrero desde hace muchos años, actividad que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y darle lo mejor a su esposa quien depende de él.
Hoy le da gracias a Dios por haberle permitido llegar a esta edad y haber preparado profesionalmente a todos sus hijos quienes no dependen de él ya que es la mejor herencia que les puede dejar.
Don Martín se siente muy a gusto y agradecido con Ceprodel porque gracias a los fondos Kiva le financiaron su primer crédito para terminar el proyecto de construir la cocina de su vivienda.
Hoy en la actualidad está solicitando un crédito para mejorar su salud con el cual piensa comprar medicamentos, realizarse exámenes y ultrasonidos para ver realmente que es en si el problema que le afecta.
Confía en Dios que le apoyarán nuevamente con este financiamiento ya que como todo Nicaragüense de escasos recursos necesita de una mano amiga.
texts.en:
Martín Antonio is 66 years old and married. He is originally from the town of El Sauce, and he has worked as a laborer for many years, which allows him to put food on the table and offer his wife, who depends on him, the very best.
Today he is very grateful to have had such a long life and been able to give his children a good education. They are all adults now, and that is the best inheritence he could possibly offer them.
Martín is very happy and appreciative of Ceprodel. Thanks to Kiva funds he was able to take out his first loan, which he used to finish building a kitchen in his home.
He is currently applying for a loan to improve his health. He will use it to buy medications and get some tests and ultrasounds to find out what is wrong with him.
He trusts in God that he will again receive support for this new loan because, like all Nicaraguans with meager resources, he needs a helping hand.

loans.use: to buy medications and have some tests and ultrasounds done.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Fe works hard to support her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF.

Fe is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as charcoal, soap, shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell. She has successfully repaid her previous loans. Fe hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, soap, shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 35 years old and married with four children.

Erma is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Erma requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock.

Erma has been raising livestock for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock.

loans.name: Azam

texts.en:
Azam is 27 years old and unmarried. He is a young and energetic person who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Azam recently started a business selling ready-made clothing. In fact, his father helped him start his new business and now he is earning a sufficient income for his family. His father is a retired government servant and hopes that Azam will be the next person to earn an income for family. His father has great expectations for him and Azam wants to fulfill these expectations. Azam devotes all of his time and concentration to his garment shop as it is the single source of income for his family. His shop is situated in the garment market where there is a lot of competition. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a high price which causes low sales and increased effort. Azam must maintain the latest designs, rates, and delightful cloth colors to sustain his sales. The winter season is about to start and Azam does not have sufficient savings to buy garments for winter season. If he becomes unable to replace his winter season garments with summer season it will highly affect his sales.

Azam is requesting a loan from the Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy winter garments to sell. He hopes that his loan will help him purchase the garments he desires in a timely manner to cope with the market competition and expand his income. Azam says thanks to Kiva lenders and to his field partner for this support.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell

loans.name: Maria Placidia

texts.es: Doña Maria de 62 años de edad, es madre soltera vive en casa propia junto a su hija de 19 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años, es una persona muy trabajadora, conocida en la zona por la amabilidad con la que atiende a los clientes, mucha experiencia crediticia, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Maria solicita un crédito para invertirlo en el negocio en la compra de mas mercadería como golosinas, dulces, jabones, detergentes, granos básicos, aceites, sopas, pan,  etc.  así poder incrementar sus ingresos y darle a su familia un futuro económico estable.
texts.en: Maria is a 62 year old single mother who lives in her own home with her 19 year old daughter who’s in school. She’s had a store for several years. She’s a very hardworking person, well known in her neighborhood for the friendly manner she has with her customers. She has a lot of experience with getting loans, and thanks to her work she’s been able to meet the family’s expenses. Maria is asking for a loan to invest in her business and in the purchase of merchandise like sweet snacks, candies, soaps, detergents, grains, oils, soups, bread, etc. She’ll be able to increase her income and give her family a stable economic future.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like sweet snacks, candies, soaps, detergents, grains, oils, soups, bread, etc.

loans.name: Moris Efrain

texts.es: Don Moris vive en casa propia, junto a su esposa, su madre y sus dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, es una persona trabajadora, responsable con sus obligaciones, con ganas de sacar a su familia adelante, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares, Don Moris solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. Para poder incrementar sus ingresos y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Moris lives in his own home with his wife, his mother, and his two children. He’s been growing corn for several years. Moris is a very hardworking person. He takes care of his obligations and uses his income to help get the family ahead. Thanks to his work he’s been able to pay for the family’s household expenses. 

Moris is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies to grow corn like seeds, manure, fertilizer, products to control disease, etc. in order to increase his income and give his family the quality of life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, products to control diseases, etc.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 55 years old and widowed with ten children.

Narcisa works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, shampoo, noodles, etc.

Narcisa has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Narcisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, shampoo, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es una persona que se dedica a la cría de vacas lecheras para la extracción de leche cruda y además a la elaboración de quesillo de muy buena calidad. Vive junto a su esposo en la ciudad de Cochabamba.
Hilda trabaja desde su corta edad en la cría de vacas lecheras, actualmente existe escases de agua en la zona donde tiene su actividad, por tal motivo no existe mucho alimento fresco para la alimentación del ganado. Es por esa razón que Hilda necesita dinero para poder comprar alimento que pueda conservar como la cascara de soya y de esta manera no descuide la alimentación de sus vacas y estas puedan seguir produciendo leche con normalidad. Con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de seguir con su negocio   y evitar que la producción de leche de su ganado disminuya y de esta manera no disminuyan sus ingresos mantenga su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Hilda raises dairy cows for their milk and also to make a very good quality cheese. She lives with her husband in the city of Cochabamba. 

Hilda has been raising dairy cows since her youth. Right now there are water shortages in the area where she works so there’s not much fresh feed for her cattle. For that reason Hilda needs money to buy feed which she can store, like soy hulls. Then she won’t have to stop feeding her cattle, and they can continue to produce milk as usual. 

With this loan she’ll have the opportunity to continue her business and avoid a decrease in her cattle’s milk production. Then her income won’t decrease, and she can maintain her current standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Fadhila

texts.en:
Fadhila is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fadhila cooks fried potatoes and sells them to neighbors and passersby.  She cites seasonality as her biggest challenge.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil.  She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crop.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a married parent with four children, two of whom are in school. She works selling food in the Philippines and also earns additional income from running a general store. Nora works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans through NWTF.

Nora is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Cherlita

texts.en:
Cherlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Cherlita has been in this business for 11 years.  Cherlita earns additional income from her general store.

Cherlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa de un familiar junto a su hijo, ella se dedica a la comercialización de ropa casual y deportiva y adicionalmente  vende zapatos por encargo, comercializa en una zona bastante transitada lo que la llevado a obtener un buen nivel de ventas, posee muy buenas referencias, conocida por responsable y trabajadora, además posee muy buena capacidad de pago. La clienta esta solicitando un crédito para aumentar sus inventarios en la compra de mas camisas, calcetines, shorts, blusas etc. y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo
texts.en: This client lives with her son and she sells casual as well as athletic clothing. She also sells shoes through personal orders. She works in an area of her town that sees a lot of traffic and has allowed her to have a good level of sales. She has many references, is known to be responsible, hard working, and has a financial stability that will allow her to make steady payments. This client is applying for a loan to help her increase her inventory and to purchase shirts, socks, shorts, blouses and more. By doing so, she will be able to improve the quality of life of her and her son.

loans.use: purchase shirts, socks, shorts, blouses etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a married mother with four children. She works selling clothing in the Philippines and she earns additional income from fattening pigs. Celia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. 

Celia is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more clothing to offer for sale. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Don Dagoberto de 32 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, él se dedica a la venta de verduras y adicionalmente posee una venta de collares, pulseras, anillos, etc. todo artesanales, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en una zona muy transitada, es una persona honesta, trabajadora, amable, gracias a sus labores ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Don Dagoberto solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos por mayor ya que esa actividad es muy productiva en la zona donde el reside, con esta nueva inversión podrá obtener mejores ganancias y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dagoberto is 32 years old and lives in his own house with his partner and their three children. He earns a living by selling vegetables and also has a small stand where he sells necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc, all of which are handcrafted. His business is located in a well-traveled area. 

Dagoberto is honest, hard-working, and friendly. Thanks to his hard work, he has managed to pay off many of his household expenses. He is now requesting a loan to purchase pigs wholesale, as this activity is lucrative in the area where he lives. With this new investment, he will be able to increase his income and therefore improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs wholesale.

loans.name: Frainer Adolfo

texts.es: Frainer es un hombre de 29 años de edad, soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Nació y creció en un pueblo de la región antioqueña, pero hace algunos años se trasladó a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades para salir adelante. El año pasado inició una legumbrería con la que obtuvo muy buenos resultados pero, se le presentó una buena oportunidad y vendió el negocio, con el dinero que obtuvo de esa venta adquirió un vehículo.  El cliente es humilde, amable, trabajador y siempre tiene una actitud emprendedora que lo motiva a buscar opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por esto desea iniciar otro negocio, un lavadero de carros, para lo cual ya posee un local, pero requiere el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos y herramientas de trabajo necesarias (hidrolavadora, aspiradora, productos para lavar los vehículos) y realizar mejoras locativas, para así darle inicio a su proyecto de negocio, aprovechando la oportunidad de la buena ubicación del local y que ya posee algunos clientes entre familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector. Con esta plan de negocio, Frainer desea generar mejores ingresos  con los cuales pueda acreditar bien su negocio y lograr que sea reconocido para que día a día se incremente su clientela y así tener la oportunidad de ahorrar para comprar una vivienda propia y disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Frainer is 29 years old, single, and doesn't have any children. He was born and raised in the Antioquia region, but moved to the city several years ago in search of better opportunities in order to get ahead in life. 

Last year, he started a business selling legumes which was successful, but he was offered a good opportunity and sold the business. With the money obtained, he purchased a vehicle. Frainer is humble, friendly, hard-working, and has an entrepreneurial attitude which motivates him to seek opportunities for bettering his situation. Because of this, he would like to start a new business: washing cars. He already has the space for the business, but needs financial support to purchase the necessary supplies and tools (e.g. a power washer, vacuum cleaner, products to wash the cars) and to renovate and improve the space. This will give his a business a good start, and will allow him to take advantage of the good location and the fact that he already has some clients, including relatives, friends, and neighbors in the area. 

With this business plan, Frainer hopes to increase his income, improve his business, and grow his clientele, thus giving him the opportunity to save money to buy his own home and to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and the necessary tools (e.g. power-washer, vacuum cleaner, products for washing cars) and to make improvements to  his place of business.

loans.name: Sadam

texts.en:
Sadam is a 27-year-old, single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He didn’t complete his studying due to difficult challenges he faced. He has been selling perfumes and getting a low income. 

He has a small house which needs some improvements and renovation. So, he has requested a youth loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy construction materials to repair his house. With this, he hopes to have a more respectable home and to live better with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Isolina Noemi

texts.es: Doña Isolina vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida tiene dos  hijos que son independientes pero que le ayudan económicamente,  ella se dedica al elaboración y ventas de tortillas desde hace varios años, además posee una tienda y vende productos de belleza, es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus labores, gracias a su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos han  logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos. Doña Isolina solicita un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio en la compra de maíz por mayor y cal, y asi aumentar sus ganancias y darle su familia la calidad de vida que se merece.
texts.en:
Isolina lives in her own house with her life partner.  She has two children who are independent, but they help her financially.  She has been making and selling tortillas for several years.  She also has a store, and she sells beauty products.  She is a very responsible person, and she is dedicated to her work.  Thanks to her work, and with the help of her husband and children, they have managed to pay many of their expenses.

Isolina is requesting a loan in order to continue investing in her business.  She will buy corn and lime powder wholesale.  This way she will increase her earnings and give her family the quality of life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime powder wholesale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 62 years old and married with seven children.

Rosita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP (Philippine pesos) 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of four children, two in school, one adult and one underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Saumu has operated a makuti (palm leaves used for roof-thatch) selling business at the market for the past three years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs (Kenyan shillings) 30,000, she wants to purchase palm leaves for resale. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves for resale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer, 29, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is still single and lives with her parents. She is helping them generate income for their family. She is also helping them manage their household.

Jennifer operates a room rental business. The room is rented on a monthly basis. She also has a junk shop as a source of income. She earns a minimum of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will use the loan for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent.

Jennifer dreams to become a successful businesswoman. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is asking for a loan because she believes that through it, she will improve her business.

Riziki would like to diversify her businesses. The previous loan enabled her to save money to open this new coconut-selling business. However, she still sells makuti (roof thatching materials). She is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of coconuts for her business.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling crabs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional crabs to sell for her business buying and selling crabs.

Helen has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from a general store.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Erna works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Erna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, eggs, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Erna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, eggs, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Guadalupe Auxiliadora

texts.es: Guadalupe tiene 24 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 3 años. En esta actividad la apoya su mama. Ella comercializa sus productos en casa. Tiene como expectativa de su negocio aumentar su clientela y poder convertir su pulpería en miscelánea. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jugos y golosinas con el fin de brindar un servicio variado y de calidad. Estima que al adquirir el financiamiento podrá aumentar su inventario e ingresos, lo cual es de beneficio para su entorno familiar. Su plan futuro es implementar la venta de cosméticos. Se considera una persona con deseo de superación y sobre todo con mucho interés  de crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 24 years old. She is a merchant and has made her living through a grocery store business for three years. Her mother helps her with this business. 

She sells her products in her house. Her expectation for her business is to increase her customers and be able to convert her grocery store into miscellany.

She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, juices and candies, with the goal of providing a diverse and quality service. She estimates that acquiring the financing will make her able to increase her inventory and income, which is beneficial for her family. 

Her future plan is to being selling cosmetics. She is considered a person with a desire to excel and, above all else, with a lot of interest in growing her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, juices and candies.

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en:
Muqadas is a 35 year old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of 6 children, who are growing older and whose needs are also growing.  
Her husband has a business of providing services to carry sand and soil from one place to another.  He has been doing this work for many years and generating reasonable income for his family.  Nowadays his trolley is broken due to overloading and jerks around on the road.  He is a poor person and does not have sufficient money to fix the problem.  Due to this reason he is unable to continue his services and his income is zero. 

Therefore, Muqadas requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; her husband will use this amount to maintain the tractor trolley so he can start his services again. 
Muqadas says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: for the maintenance of a tractor trolley.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 36 years old and married with three children.

Anecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Anecita has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal for ten years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Anecita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Geoconda Benita

texts.es: Geoconda Benita  reside en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país, tiene 41 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como ropa para niños, cosméticos, prendas, ropa usada peluches y también tiene un puesto de comida en la terminal de buses de su domicilio donde tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, ella solicita crédito para capital de trabajo, una sus expectativas es poder mejorar sus ingreso para poder tener una estabilidad económica en su hogar, ella agradece la ayuda que los Inversionistas Kivas le ofrecen a ella y otras personas con escasos recursos y a países pobres como Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de trabajo.
texts.en:
Geoconda Benita lives in the Chinandega department in the west of the country. She is 41 years old and makes her living selling general merchandise, such as children's clothing, cosmetics, clothing, used clothing and stuffed animals. 

She also has a food stall at the bus terminal at her house, where she has permanent and temporary customers. She is a very hard-working person with many hopes of overcoming. 

She is asking for the loan for working capital. One of her goals is to be able to improve her income to have economic stability in her household. She is grateful for the help of Kiva investors, who give her and other people with scarce resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua some dignity in work.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as a serious hard worker. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker that will benefit six family members. They will be able to have a good cooking system that will enable them to cook easily and efficiently.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, 48, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a construction worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lourdes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 25,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lourdes dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a good life and good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois has a cereal selling business in Kangundo town. She is 56 years old and widowed. She has six children and has been in this business for eight years.

This will be her fifth loan term with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of cereals to sell. These cereals include maize, beans, and cow peas. She will use the generated profits to buy a cow. 

Lois hopes to grow her business and make more income and therefore be able to assist in paying the school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of a son. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Fatima has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to maintain the engine, to buy a tire and maintain the seats for passengers of his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Fatima is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

She says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of a rickshaw for transportation business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old and married with two children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, etc.

Alicia has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish and raising pig.

Alicia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with three children, two in school and one who is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanatumu operates a food making business, making items like, beans and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbors. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase food items, like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Jose Santana

texts.es: Don José de 48  años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, él se dedica a la venta y compra de cerdos  desde hace mas de cinco años, y desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muy buena capacidad de pago, es persona muy responsable y trabajadora, gracias a las labores que realiza ha logrado solventar muchos de sus familiares. Don José solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para la agricultura como: fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas,  controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y poder continuar con sus cultivos y así aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 48 years old and lives in his own house with his live partner. He has earned his living buying and selling pigs for more than five years, and for several years he has grown beans and corn. 

He has a very good ability to pay. He is a very responsible and hard-working person. Thanks to the work he has carried out, he has been able to support many of his relatives. 

José is asking for a loan to buy inputs for agriculture, such as fertilizers, compost, herbicides, pest control and improving the ground which is shown in the photo. He will be able to continue his crops and thus increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, herbicides, pest control and improve the ground.

loans.name: Romel

texts.en: Romel is a 33 years old, married, has five children, and resides in Obay, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte in the Philippines. For three years, he has helped his wife run a sari sari store while he manages their own farm to make a living. He joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, sugar, flour, and noodles as additional working inventory capital.
