Gemma hopes to be more knowledgeable in business and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.es:
Ramonita es una persona muy luchadora y que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que está estudiando, ya que quiere ser alguien en la vida.
Ramonita está estudiando Maestría en Psicología Clínica, con lo que quiere poder ampliar   sus conocimientos y seguir aprendiendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en los gastos de transportación y también para poder invertirlo en sus materiales, ya que es lo que más necesita para poder seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Ramonita is a hard-working person who wants to move forward. This is why she is studying, so she can be someone in life. Ramonita is studying for a Master's in Clinical Psychology, which will help her expand her knowledge and keep learning.

She is requesting this loan to invest in transportation costs and also to buy her supplies, since this is what she needs most to keep going to school. She is grateful for this opportunity because it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to pay transportation costs and buy supplies.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, aged 36, is a resident living in the Ponhea Lueu district of Kandal province. He earns a living by farming rice and lotus fruits with full support from his wife and children. He also earns additional income by working as a day laborer and being on guard duty. Through his hardships, he is able to make a reasonable income to cover their expenses.

Now he needs a loan to purchase farm supplies for his crops such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. This way he can make sure that his crops are in optimal conditions. With the profit he expects to make from farming as a result of the loan, he will repay the loan to lenders and provide basic living needs and education to his four school-aged children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for his crops such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, quiere poder culminar mis estudios, poder recibirse y asi conseguir un trabajo digno y ser una buena profesional y  ayudar a su familia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas y servir a la comunidad. Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y de esa forma poder seguir luchando y estar cada vez más cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Griselda is from the city of Paraguari and wants to finish her studies. In this way she will find a dignified job and be a professional in order to support her family. 

She is studying for a nursing degree and wants to be able to help others and serve her community. Griselda is a person who wants to get ahead. She is requesting this loan to invest in the payment of her college fees and in this way continue working hard and getting closer to her goal

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba es madre soltera, sigue viviendo con sus padres, está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, está en el último año. Se ve dentro de poco como abogada en su propio estudio jurídico.
Su meta es salir adelante con la ayuda de su familia y su hijo, ella quiere poder darles todo lo que no tuvo y así mejorar sus vidas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y sus clases y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y estar cada vez más cerca de su objetivo.
texts.en: Alba is a single mother who continues living with her parents. She is studying Law and is in her final year. She will soon be a lawyer with her own firm. Her goal is to get ahead with the support of her family and son. She wants to be able to give them all that she did not have and in this way improve their lives. She is requesting this loan to pay for her college fees and enrollment. In this way she will be able to continue studying and little by little, get closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay her college fees and enrollment.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 41 years old and comes from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two children ages 14 and 21. For 19 years now, she has been engaged in making dresses for her customers. This is her main livelihood.

Leonora would like to focus on her business and be fast on orders and requests. She is asking for a loan to buy buttons, textiles, thread and zippers. This will help so she can always be prepared for her customers' requests. Her profits will pay for school fees and for food for her family. In the future, she hopes that with her income she can successfully afford to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy buttons, textiles, thread and zippers

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is a married woman. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She has operated a water selling business for the past years, selling to neighbors and fellow villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. She is requesting a loan of Kshs 25,000 because she wants to purchase a water pipe to use in water installation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water pipe to use in water installation.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is separated from her husband and lives in Obay, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte, along with her children. She makes a living by selling snacks in their community and at the same time raising pigs for sale. She earns money from the business and is able to support the needs of the family. She joined GDMPC recently and took a loan of 5,000 PHP to expand her pig shelter. She always hopes to gain more income and to be able to save for her family’s future needs.

loans.use: to renovate her pig shelter

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is 65 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and son in Dusheti district. Gulnara and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. The family has no other source of income. Gulnara has a commercial space where she opened a food market, but she does not have enough money for purchasing a stock of food and groceries to sell. 

She requested a loan, but as the family belongs to the subsistence poor category, and they have no source of income and live in poverty, she lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business. These institutions require stable income and business experience.  

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Gulnara to get a loan of $1,800. She will purchase a stock of merchandise such as food, groceries and household goods. Gulnara thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. 

After the food market is filled, she will be able to offer a wide assortment of products to her customers and the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With the support of the Start Up program, Gulnara will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle any financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of food for her newly opened market.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña katupyry  está en su ciclo número 4º  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación en la que cada una se encuentra y que puntos deben mejorar. Una de ellas es Laura, quien está con ingresos buenos, pero el desafío es que los mantenga, es por eso que se está esforzando.
Ella realiza trabajos de lavandería, y comenta que es un trabajo duro, pero que está contenta, ya que es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto. Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de jabones, suavizantes y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo y seguir ganándose el sustento para su familia.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Katupyry" group communal bank is in their fourth cycle of the Woman's Committee Program. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey, so as to understand the situation that each of them is in, and what steps need to be taken in order to improve.

Laura is one member, who has good income. Her challenge is to maintain this level and she is working to do that. She does laundry and says that it is hard work. But she is content, as it is dignified work and above all honest. She is requesting this loan to buy soap, softener and other supplies to continue her work and continue generating money to support her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, softener and other supplies.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a very hardworking woman who lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She operates a hotel business where she makes various food like beans, rice, tea and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children, ages 1 to 13. Her husband works as a tractor operator to support their family. Merlina, on the other hand, is engaged in hog raising and farming rice to help augment the income of their household. Her business started a year ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings. The loan will provide hope in her planned business expansion and sustainability. She hopes to keep her business so that her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en: Rafik is 63 years old and he lives in the village Dsegh in Lori region. Rafik is married and he has a son who now lives in the Russian Federation, and from time to time tries to help his parents financially. Rafik works as a forester and he has shift work. Having free time gives Rafik an opportunity to be engaged in farming; particularly he has become skilled in swine breeding with which his wife helps him very much. Rafik manages to sell some pork to their city butchers. He is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for the coming winter months.

loans.use: To buy a lot of animal fodder for the coming winter months.

loans.name: Shamba

texts.en:
Shamba lives in Likoni area near Mombasa, Kenya. She is 45 years old and married with five children. Three of her children attend school. For the last ten years she has been operating a food café that has been feeding her family. This business is the only source of income for her and so she works every day to make sure that it succeeds. She has been able to employ two people who help her run the business. 

She learned of Milango through a friend and now she seeks a loan to buy items like wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her café. The extra income that she will raise will improve her living standards and create more opportunities for people.

loans.use: to buy items like wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nidia Magaly

texts.es:
Nidia es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello día a día trabaja como obrera en una fábrica textil de su ciudad en el área de acabados, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y cree que le está yendo bien en su trabajo porque es muy detallista y responsable.

Nidia esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales como arena, cemento, ladrillos, entre otros  para poder realizar refacciones en su techo, de esta manera podrá tener una vivienda más segura y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y ser un gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Nidia is a young women with a great desire to get ahead. In order to do so, she works by day in a textile factory in her city making the finishing touches on the garments. She works about eight hours daily and believes that her work is going well for her because she is very detail-oriented and responsible. 

Nidia is grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help that they are offering her, she will be able to buy materials including sand, cement, bricks, etc. in order to repair her roof. In this way she will have a more secure home and be able to work to make her dream come true: study for a college degree and become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a widowed mother of two children, whom she has been taking care of since her husband passed away twenty years ago, leaving her with two babies to take care of and be the mother and the father at the same time.  

She started her home-based business to make sure that she could take care of both her children and run a business at the same time. She started a Mouneh business, which is based on conserving food from one season to another in a very special way. She also prepares tomato pastes to be used in certain cooking needs, as well as several kinds of jam.

Her business is quite enough to cover her family's needs, but not for any extra required need. Today, Layla is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to add a new bedroom to her house. She hopes that one day in the future she'll be able to take care of necessary maintenance to the whole place and to open a separate working place.

loans.use: To add a new bedroom to her house.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 40 years old and married, with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Geraldine has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her weaving.

Geraldine has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for the children.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. Apart from that, she raises poultry to supplement her income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan she is requesting of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Doña María Elena es una señora de 42 años, madre de tres hijos dos de ellos a su cargo menores de edad estudiando la primaria y secundaria. Se graduó como maestra de educación primaria y desde hace 14 años ejerce la profesión en el colegio de la comarca de Río Grande donde habita también. Este caserío está ubicado a 12 kilómetros del municipio de El Sauce el cual se llama así porque lo divide un inmenso río del municipio de Achuapa.
Doña María Elena se siente muy agradecida con los inversionistas de Kiva y Ceprodel por haberle apoyado en el otorgamiento de su primer crédito que fue para mejorar su salud, ya que con su salario no puede cubrir estos gastos.
Actualmente se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de otro financiamiento el cual lo quiere para Compra de medicamentos, pago de consultas médicas y realización de exámenes, con el fin de seguir mejorando su salud y para rendir mejor en su trabajo ya que es el que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar porque sus hijos solamente dependen de ella.
Pone sus esperanzas en Dios y en estas personas de buen corazón para que le sigan apoyando a ella y a muchas familias más.
texts.en:
María Elena, 42, is a mother of three children, two of whom are minors under her care studying in elementary and high school. 

She graduated as a primary school teacher and has worked in this profession for the past 14 years at a school in the Rio Grande region where she also lives. 
The village is located 12 kilometers from the El Sauce municipality. It is named this way because there is a huge river that divides it from the Archuapa municipality. 

María Elena is very grateful to the Kiva investors and Ceprodel for supporting her in receiving her first loan which helped improve her health. She was unable to cover these costs just with her salary.  

Recently she returned to the Ceprodel office requesting another loan to buy medicine, pay for doctors visits and exams. Her goal is to improve her health and be able to perform better at work which is what allows her to put food on the table since her sons depend on her solely.

She puts her hopes in God and these good hearted people that they keep supporting her and many other families.

loans.use: to buy medicine, pay for doctors visits and exams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install concrete flooring in front of his home.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: As the married mother of two children, Monica works hard to support her family. She has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 from NWTF to buy raw materials to use for weaving. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her mat-weaving business.

loans.name: Sugey Del Milagro

texts.es: Sugey es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Tiene 27 años de edad, casada y madre de 1 hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos y vehículos. En este negocio la apoya su esposo quien comercializa y  diseña el estilo de las motos. Inicio esta actividad vendiendo aceite y lubricantes para carros, poco a poco con esfuerzo y sacrificio ha ido creciendo económicamente. Su expectativa es invertir en productos, los cuales tienen  demanda, con el fin de cumplir las necesidades de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: focos, espejos, llantas, rines, aceite, lubricantes y líquido de frenos. Estima que al invertir en su negocio, sus ventas aumentaran. Su meta próxima es expandir su negocio y lograr ser el líder en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sugey is originally from Granada. She is 27 years old, married and mother of one child. She is a businesswoman who sells auto parts. Her husband helps her with the business as he markets and custom designs motorbikes. Sugey started out by oil and lubricants for cars and little by little through her effort and sacrifice her business has grown economically. She hopes to invest in products that are in demand, in order to fulfill the wishes of her customers.

Sugey is requesting this loan to buy lights, mirrors, tires, rims, oil, lubricants and brake fluid. She believes that investing in her business will produce greater sales. Her next goal is to expand her business and become the leader in her market.

loans.use: to buy lights, mirrors, tires, rims, oil, lubricants and brake fluid.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 33 years old from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and a father to his five-year-old boy.  For five years now, Michael has made his livelihood through his tricycle business. His income provides food for his family.

Michael is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP to buy oil and chain for his tricycle. With the new parts, he will be assured of continued business and better income for his family.

In the future, he hopes to start another kind of business to venture on.

loans.use: to buy oil and chain for his tricycle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 29-year-old married man and the father of one child. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen, where he runs an auto repair shop and has several employees. This is his family's sole source of income. He used to be an employee elsewhere, but saved up enough money to open his own shop. He works hard because he wants to give his family everything they need for a dignified life without hardship. He would like to buy supplies for his business and is requesting a youth loan for 200,000 YER from AMB to buy the repair materials necessary to run his shop and increase his profit. In the future, he plans to open a retail business.

loans.use: to buy the auto repair materials necessary to run his shop and to increase his profit.

loans.name: Hepolita

texts.en: Hepolita lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married, has three grown children and earns a living by planting and harvesting bananas. In the past seven years of farming, she has earned a good income from her work. Hepolita successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for her farm.  She is requesting a loan for 40,000 PHP to expand her farm and hopefully gain a more abundant harvest in return.

loans.use: to pay to plow and fertilize her farm.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo vive en la ciudad de Pisco, tiene 39 años y es un hombre con ganas de salir adelante, Oswaldo para poder llevar un plato de comida a su hogar trabaja en una  institución de su ciudad como empleado, también trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para los gastos del hogar, Oswaldo cree que poco a poco está saliendo adelante porque se esfuerza mucho y porque es responsable.

Oswaldo agradece a los prestamistas kiva por la ayuda que le están brindando ya que con ello podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo y también podrá realizar reparaciones en el piso de su vivienda, de esta manera mejorara sus ingresos y también mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia, así seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Oswaldo lives in the city of Pisco and is 39 years old. He is a man who has a great desire to get ahead. In order to put food on the table at home, Oswaldo works in an institution within his city. He also works as a rickshaw driver. With this he has extra money for his household expenses. Oswaldo believes that little by little he is getting ahead because he works hard and is responsible. 

Oswaldo is grateful toward the Kiva lenders for the help that they are bringing him because with this help he will be able to cover his vehicle maintenance and also be able to make some repairs to his home's floor. In this way he will improve his earnings and his family's standard of living. He will continue working hard to fulfill his greatest dream: to have a dignified home.

loans.use: to pay for car maintenance and home improvements.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is a 28-year-old hardworking woman with two children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a bar and a tea room while also earning a salary as a teacher. Her main challenges are customers who do not pay their bills on time and price fluctuations. Jolly intends to use this loan to buy beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell.

loans.name: Margaretha

texts.en:
Margaretha is a 60-year-old widow. She lives with three children: Evi, 28, Damaris, 22, both are workers and Israel, 9 years old and in 4th grade in elementary school. 

Margaretha has a business selling Nasi Kuning (yellow rice with side dishes such as omelet, tempe and noodles) at a Junior High School nearby her house. She has been involved in this business for six years. In addition to selling yellow rice, Margaretha also sells pudding and fruit ice to generate more income. 

At the moment, Margaretha needs money for her daughter's graduation fees. Due to the lack of money, she requested an individual loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to pay her children's graduation fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes de este comité están contentas por formar parte del programa de comité, ya que por medio de este podrán ir mejorando en sus trabajos y capacitarse. Un ejemplo es la Sra. Hermelinda, quien es la presidenta del grupo, y comenta que ella siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras a esforzarse al máximo por lograra sus objetivos.
Hermelinda se dedica a la costura y hoy pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo hasta ahora. Agradecen por esta oportunidad que reciben de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The 16 members of this committee are happy to be part of the programme as, thanks to it, they can improve their work and do training.  One member of the group is Hermelinda, the president.  She tells us that she is always trying to motivate her fellow group-members to put in the maximum effort to achieve their objectives.  

Hermelinda makes a living in dressmaking and today is asking for this loan in order to invest in buying materials and threads.  With this she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing up until now.  The group is grateful for this opportunity to keep on growing.

loans.use: to buy material and threads to use for dressmaking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car that will serve as a taxi.

loans.name: Lisseth Giovanna

texts.es:
Lisseth es una mujer de 30 años, Lisseth no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar una pequeña carrera técnica de corte y confección, la cual le ha servido de mucho. Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace dos años Lisseth trabaja en su pequeño negocio de confección y costura de ropa, adicionalmente también trabaja vendiendo pollos, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes. 

Lisseth agradece a los prestamistas kiva  ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción para poder seguir mejorando su vivienda y seguir luchando para lograr su sueño de terminar la construcción de su casa y poder seguir ayudando a su hermana menor para que se convierta en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Lisseth is 30 years old.  She was not able to go to university but, thanks to her efforts, she completed a technical education in dressmaking and tailoring.  This training has helped her a lot.  Through her own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Lisseth has had her own tailoring and dressmaking business for two years.  In addition she works selling chickens.  Lisseth works every day from early in the morning, and keeps going for around eight hours.  She thinks the work is going well because of her dedication and because of the friendly treatment she gives to her customers.

Lisseth thanks Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support provided, she will be able to buy construction materials in order to continue improving her home and to achieve her dream of finishing building her house.  She can also continue to support her younger sister as she trains to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Anselma works hard to support her family.

She has a mat weaving business in the Philippines, and earns an additional income from selling vegetables. Anselma is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

Anselma has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children in school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat weaving business.

loans.name: Sylivester

texts.en: Sylivester is a 28-year-old married man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is involved in a transport business but also makes bricks to earn a living. He is faced with challenges of unpredictable weather changes and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand, and his vision is to buy land, build a house and expand on his brick making project. Sylivester intends to use the loan to make bricks to sell.

loans.use: to make bricks to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a detergent selling business; her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbors. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase chemicals to use in preparing detergents for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals to use in preparing detergents for sale.

loans.name: María  Isabel

texts.es: La señora María es una mujer emprendedora, de profesión Psicóloga Terapeuta, tiene su propia  clínica donde labora y también a domicilio, actividad que le permite mantener su hogar, es ajuntada con un señor que le ayuda a los gastos del, hogar, tiene  un hijo a quien le brinda el apoyo para su desarrollo,  esta señora visito las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para mejorar las condiciones de su  consultorio, ya que el mismo lo utilizaría en la compra de Pintura, Madera de Pino, Mano de obra y aceite, el que le permitirá darle mejor imagen al mismo
texts.en:
María's an enterprising woman who's a therapeutic psychologist.  She has her own clinic and also works at home, which allows her to support her household.  She lives with a man who helps her with the household expenses.  She supports the growth of her son.

María visited the CEPRODEL offices to request a loan to improve the conditions in her office.  She'll use the loan to buy paint, pine wood, and oil, and to pay for labor.  This will help her improve the appearance of her office.

loans.use: to buy paint, wood, and oil, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
ASINA who is in her early 40s is married and has four children who are still going to school.  She has been involved in different types of businesses, such as selling fabrics, home utensils, Batiki (tie dye) and liquid soap for ten years now.  She works from 6.00 am to 8.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be ASINA's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more materials, made more Batiki pieces, and started making liquid soap.  She is really doing very well.  She used the profit to pay for school fees and bought a plot of land.  She will use this loan to make more liquid soap and to buy more materials for making more pieces of Batiki.  She dreams of building her own house.

ASINA will share this loan with her loan group "Muheza" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making more tie dye pieces and to make more liquid soap.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is married and has four children. He is 54 years old and lives in Romarate, Aurora, ZDS, Philippines. Ricardo used his previous loans for farm inputs and improvement. He is a successful farmer who works tirelessly to improve his family's living standards.  He is able to cultivate the adjacent farm land and he needs money for fertilizer such as manure and plowing labor costs. He borrowed a loan recently and made his plan a reality. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business and continue improve the living conditiions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 50 years old and a rice farmer in Talibon, Bohol. She has one daughter who lives with her. Julieta has been a farmer for 30 years now. She is asking for a loan to continue her livelihood. She will use her loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. Julieta hopes that in the future she can have a bigger farm that will enable her to have bigger income that she can reinvest in her business. 

Her profit is for food and savings.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
This is Pelagia. Her previous loan helped her buy more products for her business. She also used the loan for the education of her children. She has been in this business for four years now. She continues to work together with her husband to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan in order to buy more inventory of slippers and sandals for kids, men, and women. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pelagia hopes that her business will be more flourishing and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of slippers and sandals for kids, men, and women

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is 65 years old. She lives in Zestaponi district. Nargiz is provided with a retirement pension. Nowadays she has no source of income, but is a very hard-working woman and motivated to run her own business. She belongs to the subsistence poor category, as she lives under poverty line. 

According to the above mentioned situation, Nargiz lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require a stable income and business experience. 

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of $300 and start her own business. She will purchase a stock of merchandise, such as groceries and household goods, then she will open a grocery store in her yard, near the main road. 

Nargiz thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of its kind in the area. After the grocery store is opened, she will have a stable income, which enables her to cover her everyday costs, as well as expand the business in the future.

With support of the Start Up program, Nargiz will have an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries and household goods to open a grocery store in her yard.

loans.name: Antonio Cruz

texts.es: Antonio es un hombre ejemplar, además de ser jubilado se dedica también a la actividad pecuaria,  como es la producción láctea, de la cual tiene 24 años de ejercerla llegando a mejorar  la calidad del hato ganadero, como pequeño productor se siente satisfecho hasta la fecha, es casado con un hijo el que involucra en estas actividades y lo apoya en sus estudios,  este señor visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que lo utilizaría en la compra de una Vaca para incrementar la productividad y abastecer la demanda, lo que le vendría a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio's an exemplary man.  In addition to being retired, he also works in agriculture producing milk.  He has 24 years of experience improving the quality of his herd of cattle.  As a small producer he has been satisfied up to the present.  He's married and has a child who's involved in these activities, and Antonio supports him in his studies.

Antonio visited CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy a cow to increase his productivity and satisfy demand.  This will improve his living conditions and his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory needed for the business

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the 35,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase two sacks of dried fish and 1 tonne of firewood.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of dried fish and 1 tonne of firewood

loans.name: Mahoutin 2 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUTIN 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Eugenie (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur Martin. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Eugenie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges familiales, Eugenie vend des plastiques, du charbon de bois et divers articles à son domicile. Eugenie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C'est la troisième fois que Eugenie sollicite un financement de ALIDé ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUTIN 2 ; ce qui leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en: Mahoutin 2 is a group of three people, whose members live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same tontine [savings group]. The representative of the group, Eugenie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 52 years old and is married to a chauffeur named Martin. The couple has four children, some of which are in school and all of which are their dependents. Eugenie lives together with her children and husband. The couple together takes care of various family responsibilities. To do so, Eugenie sells plastics, charcoal, and other items from her home. Eugenie buys her supplies in a market in Benin. This is the third time that Eugenie is seeking funding from Alidé together with the other members of Mahoutin 2 group, which will allow them to build their business and better serve their customers.

loans.use: to buy plastic and charcoal

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Fatmata from Kambia northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 6 and 21 years. She also has two relatives at home. In 1998, Fatmata established her palm oil business. She began her business because she did not go to school and she was trained for the business.  She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is poor road network within her operation area.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and native rice for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and repay her loan. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and native rice for resale

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is a 24-years old married woman, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small crockery shop, in which he sells glasses only. He is a responsible son and a husband.

Her husband is the only source of income, and he has to afford the expenses of utility bills, medical expenses of his old parents, and household expenses. 
It's been a few months since their wedding. and her husband had to spend his all savings for the marriage ceremony, and does not have enough money to buy inventory for his crockery shop. 

Mehwish and her husband are currently living in his father's house and her husband wants to construct his own house, and for this purpose more earnings are required so that he could save some money to construct his house. Therefore, Mehwish requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could increase the inventory and earnings as well.

She hopes that her husband will construct his house soon with the help of profit amount, so that his family members can live a more comfortable life.  

Mehwish is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase crockery for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for degree expenses

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: La Sra. Santusa vive en la comunidad de Colomi, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos pequeños, económicamente es independiente, percibe ingresos económicos de la actividad agrícola, siembran en terreno de 2 Has en terreno propio producen papa, oca y haba, con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro, La Sra Santusa requiere el crédito para la construcción de vivienda ya que actualmente vive en la casa de sus abuelos y ya se encuentra deteriorada, y con esta época de lluvia tiene muchas goteras por el techo, el ahorro que tenia lo invirtió recientemente en la compra de insumos agrícolas. Santusa podrá construir dos cuartos pequeños y poder vivir más cómodamente junto a sus dos hijos, además de poder realizar el sueño de tener casa propia.
texts.en: Santusa lives in the community of Colomi. She is 31 years old and a single mother with two small children. She is economically independent. She has income from agriculture. She plants on 2 hectares of her own land where she grows potatoes, oca [a small tuber similar to a potato], and fava beans in rotation. She has experience in this business. Santusa needs the loan to build a house because she currently lives in her grandparent's house, and it is deteriorated. During the rainy season there are a lot of leaks in the roof. The savings that she had she recently spent on agricultural inputs. Santusa would be able to build two small rooms and then be able to live more comfortably with her two children, and also achieve her dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
AMOS,who is in his late 30s, is married and has four children who are still going to school.  He has been a food vendor for two and a half years now.  He works from 5.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be AMOS's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use for restocking the missing items in his food store.  He dreams of owning a Hotel.

AMOS will share this loan with his loan group "TWEYAMBE" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to restock the missing items in his food store

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur lives with his family in Kapan city. Khachatur has graduated from the Technological Institute in St. Petersburg and after getting married he began working at the local school as a teacher. Today he is already a director of the same school. His wife works as a librarian at this school. Khachatur has two daughters and son. His elder daughter is a student of Yerevan State University in a paid division; his other two children are school-aged. After his work Khachatur second part of the day spends in his garden, where he keeps beehives. Khacahtir sells the honey and it brings good income to his nice family.

Khachatur is requesting a loan of 200.000 Armenian drams in order to buy several beehives and frames for them. It will be his second loan from Kiva.  His first one he has paid back successfully and this time Khachatur hopes to receive his lenders support again.

loans.use: to buy several beehives and frames for them

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

Janice has been in this business for 17 years.

Janice has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat weaving

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mayra es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Tiene 54 años de edad, casada y madre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 1 año. Inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su esposo, ya que le brindo ayuda económica para establecer la pulpería. Comercializa sus productos en su casa junto a su hija. Tiene como expectativa expandir su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos. Estima que el credito sera de mucha ayuda ya que podra aumentar sus ventas y tener mejor calidad de vida. Solicita el crédito para comprar: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, café y golosinas con el fin de surtir su negocio y cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es tener una miscelánea y ofrecer productos nuevos.
texts.en:
Mayra is from the city of Managua. She is 54, married, and the mother of two children. A merchant by trade, she has had a small grocery store business for year. She started this business with her husband's help, as he provided financial help to set up the grocery store.

She sells her products from her home with her daughter.  Her hope is to expand her business and increase her income. She feels the loan will be a great help to her, as she will be able to increase her sales and have a better quality of life. 

She is requesting the loan to buy: rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, coffee and candy in order to stock her store and meet her customers' needs. Her plan in the future is to have a variety store and offer new products.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, coffee and candy.

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 53-year-old married woman, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is involved in the business of milk sales with the support of her husband. She has two buffaloes and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of getting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing this together to support their family.

She is the mother of four children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing, and health. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to buy one more buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

Shehnaz says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for getting milk to sell

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 44 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school.  Judy works hard to provide for her family.  She earns a living by selling dried fish in the Philippines.  Judy requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase dried fish to sell to customers.

She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming corn.  Judy aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Âgée de 32 ans, Julienne vit au Bénin et n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Julienne est mariée à un infirmier du nom de Hippolyte. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Julienne vend des boissons, de l'huile de palme et divers produits à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Julienne s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Julienne devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Julienne sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
32 years old, Julienne lives in Benin and has not attended school. She is married to a nurse named Hippolyte. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care. Julienne lives together with her children and her husband and together she and her husband take care of the different household responsibilities.

Julienne sells beverages, palm oil, and assorted products from her home. This allows her to help finance her children's education and their care. She stocks up in a region of Benin. Julienne's customer base continues to grow. In order to satisfy her customers and to increase business and revenue, Julienne is requesting a financing for the third time from ALIDé. The previously received loans were all fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and palm oil

loans.name: Sena 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SENA 1 est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Antoinette Pélagie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Antoinette Pélagie est âgée de 35 ans et est une veuve. Antoinette Pélagie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Afin de contribuer aux charges des enfants, Antoinette Pélagie vend de l'igname frit et des beignets de haricot à son domicile. Antoinette Pélagie s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Antoinette Pélagie désire obtenir un cinquième financement, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SENA 1. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Sena 1 group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of this group, named Antoinette Pélagie, is the one pictured with her hand raised. This is the fifth time this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their business.

Antoinette Pélagie is 35 years old and a widow. She is the mother of 4 children, all of whom attend school and are in her care. In order to provide for her children, she sells fried yams and bean pastries from her home. She stocks up in Benin. In order to grow her business and to better respond to the demands of her customers, Antoinette Pélagie hopes to obtain this fifth financing, together with the other members of the Sena 1 group. Their previous loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase beans and yams

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 36-years-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been sewing clothes along with her husband at home for the past 5 years to support her family. 

She has been sewing and selling clothes for many years, in fact, Parveen and her husband purchase clothes from the market, sew them, and then sell them at the nearby market. In this way they are getting maximum profit and they have attained a regular list of customers.

She is a mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with household expenses, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner to buy more clothes for sewing. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sewing and then sell at the market

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the near future. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase six sacks of coconuts to sell.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of coconuts for sale

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Maria Auxiliadora está en su ciclo número doce del programa de comité  es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, y con mucho esfuerzo están creciendo, aprenden a trabajar juntas y a ayudar las unas a las otras. Una persona de destacar es Karen, quien por medio de sus ventas es que está teniendo los ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen.
Karen vende frutas y verduras frescas todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, es una persona que se destaca por el empeño que pone, por su trabajo y ejemplo. Quiere seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo, es por eso que pide de ese crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras, y así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora group is in its twelfth cycle in the city of San Lorenzo. With much effort, they are growing, learning to work together, and helping each other. One person who stands out is Karen, who has made an adequate income to pay for her daily costs through her sales.

Karen sells fresh fruits and vegetables every day, very early. She is a person who stands out because of the effort she makes, her work, and her good example. She wants to continue investing in her work, which is why she is requesting this loan. She will use it to invest in buying fruits and vegetables, and therefore continue working.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Monhbayar

texts.en:
Munhbayar is 49 years old and lives with her father and a daughter in a Ger, which is a traditional nomadic yurt, in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her father is retired and has a health condition which requires constant care. Her daughter Uuriintsolmon, is 21 and helps her mother run the business as well as taking care of her grandfather. 

Munhbayar has been producing felt slippers, shoes, and leather clothing at home for her clients by order since 2008. She has to stay home taking care of her father and needs to cover family expenses, which is why she started her business at home. She is now well-known among the clients because of her quality and well fashioned products. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase sheep wool and leather to continue providing her merchandise to her clients. She is a hardworking, caring, and enthusiastic woman.

loans.use: to purchase sheep wool and leather to continue providing her merchandise to her clients

loans.name: Fifadji Jérônime

texts.fr: Fifadji Jérônime est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Fifadji Jérônime a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire et ne vit plus avec son mari. Fifadji Jérônime a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Fifadji Jérônime vit avec ses deux enfants et assure leurs différents besoins grâce aux revenus de son activité. Il y a environs trois ans que Fifadji Jérônime a commencé la vente de chaussures, d’ustensiles de cuisine et de boissons  par le système de distribution. C’est à Lomé au Togo que Fifadji Jérônime achète ses produits. Afin de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’être encore plus compétitive sur le marché, Fifadji Jérônime sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Fifadji Jérônime is 37 years old and lives in Benin. She stopped school at the secondary level and no longer lives with her husband. Fifadji Jérônime has two children, both of whom attend school and are in her care. She lives with her two children and is able to provide for their different needs thanks to the earnings from her business.

It was about three years ago that Fifadji Jérônime began selling shoes, kitchen utensils, and beverages via a distribution system. She purchases her products in Lomé in Togo. In order to increase the level of her business and to be increasingly competitive in the market, she is requesting a new loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Dyesel

texts.en:
Dyesel is 39 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Dyesel has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. Dyesel requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

Dyesel has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Dyesel would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

loans.name: Sedjro Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEDJRO est formé de six personnes qui sont des amies appartenant à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Pascaline Zansi, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Pascaline Zansi est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Louis. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et cinq restent à leur charge. Pascaline Zansi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de contribuer aux charges de la maison, Pascaline Zansi vend des bois de chauffage et divers articles à son domicile. Pascaline Zansi s’approvisionne dans sa région. Pascaline Zansi exerce cette activité depuis dix sept ans. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Pascaline Zansi désire obtenir un autre financement, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEDJRO. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Sedjro group is composed of six people who are friends belonging to the same "tontine" (neighborhood savings group). The group’s representative, by the name of Pascaline Zansi, is the one raising her hand in the photo. This is the fifth time that the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé, with the goal of expanding their business. Pascaline Zansi is 42 years old. Her husband’s name is Louis. They have seven children, some of whom are in school, and five of whom are still in their care. Pascaline Zansi lives together with her husband and children. In order to contribute to household needs, Pascaline Zansi sells firewood and miscellaneous articles in front of her home. She stocks up locally. She has been in this business for 17 years. With the goal of bolstering her business and better meeting customer demand, Pascaline Zansi, together with the other members of the Sedjiro group, is seeking a new loan. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy firewood and miscellaneous articles.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya.  He has 2 children and has been doing farming for 5 years.  His primary income sources are milk and eggs.  He enjoys selling farm produce, which is his biggest challenge.  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kadogo, muiru cows’.

Simon was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, “For their loans are processed quickly”.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session.  He replied, “They enable small holder farmers to get loans easily”.
Simon’s highest monthly expense is the farming costs.  When asked how the loan would benefit his family, Simon said it would improve their farming.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated.  Simon owns a cow, poultry, and a bicycle.  He does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.  This borrower does not have a mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has two children.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops, and she has been doing this work for six years.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling farm produce."   Her biggest challenge is "feeding the animals." An animal on the farm has  been given the name of "Munge the cow."

Gladys was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "They deliver their services to farmers at the doorstep."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session:  "Group members' co-guarantee helps one to get a loan easily."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how will this loan benefit her family, Gladys replied, "Will improve their livelihood from income on their farming."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Gladys owns the following:  a cow, poultry, and a bicycle, but does not own a pig, a pump, a motorcycle, or anautomobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito nets, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en: Naima is a hardworking woman with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop, and with the proceeds she was able to build rental houses from which she earns a monthly income. Reckless tenants who spoil her property and price fluctuation are her major challenges, while her dream is to trade in wholesale. Naima intends to use the loan to buy sugar, salt, and washing soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, and washing soap to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Aminata from the Kambia northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 15 years. She also has two other relatives at home. In 2002, Aminata established her palm oil business. She began her business because she did not go to school and she was trained in the business. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a poor road network within her operation area.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, beans, and coconut oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and repay her loan. In the future, Aminata plans to open a big local food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, beans, and coconut oil for resale.

loans.name: Fifonsi Ii Group

texts.fr: FIFONSI II est un groupement de neuf personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Zinhoué Ghislaine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans. Zinhoué Ghislaine ne vit plus avec son mari, mais est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à sa charge. Zinhoué Ghislaine vit seule avec ses deux enfants. Il y a trois ans, Zinhoué Ghislaine a commencé la vente d'igname et de patate douce frits dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Zinhoué Ghislaine vend des biscuits et des bombons. Zinhoué Ghislaine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité, Zinhoué Ghislaine sollicite un premier crédit ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI II. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Fifonsi II is a group of nine people, the members of whom are residents of the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Zinhoué Ghislain (with her hand raised in the photo), is 40 years old. She no longer lives with her husband, but is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school and are in her care. She lives alone with her two children.

Three years ago, Zinhoué Ghislain began selling fried yams and sweet potatoes in her region. As a side business, she also sells cookies and candies. Zinhoué Ghislain stocks up in a region of Benin. In order to raise the level of her business, she is requesting a first loan together with the other members of the Fifonsi II group. This loan will allow them to improve their businesses and to better respond to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to purchase one bag of sweet potatoes, one bag of yams, cookies, and candies

loans.name: Fedilina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Fedilina works hard to support her family.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Fedilina is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Fedilina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain to her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Umu is 38 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 12 and 27 years old.  Three of her children are going to school.  She runs a palm oil business in Kambia northern area, in Sierra Leone.  She began her business because she wants to improve herself and her family’s well-being.

She's been in this business since 1992.  She does not have any source of income except her business.  She describes her major hardship as the transportation problems and poor road networks within her operational area.

Umu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and take care of her children’s welfare.  In the future, she would like to change her business to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1980 à KADIANA chef-lieu de la dite  commune, Moussa y réside (Sous-Préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) avec ses 2 enfants et sa femme dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Mr MOUSSA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de  carburants (essence sèche, mélange, etc.).  Il est très sollicité au marché et surtout le jour de foire. 
Fort de ses années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir remboursé le prêt précédent. 
MOUSSA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter du carburant. Il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes à NIENA. Il effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
MOUSSA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Moussa was born around 1980 in the county seat of the Kadiana community (a subprefecture in the third administrative district of Mali). He lives there with his wife and children in a traditional family. Early on, he got involved in earning a living, in particular, buying and selling fuel (dry burning fuel, mixed fuel etc). He has a lot of customer demand especially on the days of the market fair. He has many years of experience this field and collaborates with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase his working capital and meet ever-growing demand. He is on his second loan, having duly repaid his first loan.
Moussa plans to use his loan to buy fuel. He buys from wholesalers in Niena. He sells at the market place retail, for cash and sometimes on credit,  to a customer base composed of both men and women. Moussa hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 90,000 West African francs, which will be used to provide for family needs, repay his loan and invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy fuel.

loans.name: Daysi Marlene

texts.es: La señora Daysi quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que con el salario de su esposo no cubre todos los pagos que hay que realizar, tiene dos hijos a su cargo los cuales aun asisten a la escuela secundaria, desde hace 17 años doña Daysi se dedica a confeccionar ropa por encargo pero debido a las dificultades ella a emprendido en elabora Faltas, Short, Bulsas, Vestidos para niñas y venderlos ya se en su casa de habitacion o en ocasiones sale a la calle gracias este negocio apoya a su esposo y los ingresos an aumentado. con este credito ella compra Materiales que utiliza para realizar sus Ropas como. Telas al por mayor, Hilos, Encajes, Elasticos, Aplicaciones. Muy agradecida con Afodenic y Fondos Kiva doña Daysi nos comparte su alegria.
texts.en: Señora Daysi wants to improve her standard of living and help her husband with the household expenses.  Her husband's salary doesn't cover all the payments they have to make.  She has two dependent children who go to secondary school.  For the last seventeen years, doña Daysi has earned her living making advanced-order clothing.  But, due to some difficulties, she has started making skirts, shorts, blouses and girls' dresses to sell in her home and sometimes as a street vendor.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to help her husband, and her income has gone up.  With this loan, doña Daysi will purchase materials to use in making her clothing, like wholesale cloth, thread, lace, elastic and appliques.  Doña Daysi is very grateful to Afodenic and the Kiva fund.  She shares her happiness with us.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 28 years old, is married, and has two children. He owns a small shop where he makes and sells food (a type of bread called kahi in Iraq and Kuba). He started his business in 2011 and has gained good experience in this field. The quality of his food has led to an increase in demand and sales, but he still doesn't have sufficient capital to buy better equipment and renovate his shop. 

Ahmed will use this loan to purchase a meat mincer and renovate his workplace. Ahmed aims to increase his profit and make more food products.
The story of Ahmed and his food shop is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients.

loans.use: Ahmed purchase a meat mincer and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 62 years old and lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has no child. 

To earn a living, Carmelita has a small restaurant business. She earns about 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Carmelita has requested a loan to purchase rice, meat, fish, vegetables and ingredients for cooking.

Carmelita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, she would like to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to pay for rice, meat, fish, vegetables and ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Marites Angel Group

texts.en:
Maricel is the featured borrower of the Marites Angel Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they came from the Philippines to work in Lebanon for their living.
Maricel is a 37-year-old married mother of four children, who left her hometown and came to work as a housekeeper to provide her children with a better living and education. Maricel supports her husband a lot. She applied for the loan which will be sent to her family back in the Philippines to cover their needs especially their school expenses.
She is in the center of the picture wearing the light blue top. As for the other group members, Daisy Joy is the first from the left, Alma the second from the left wearing black, Marites is wearing the white top and Corpuz is the first on the right.

loans.use: to send the money to her family back in the Philippines to cover their needs especially their school expenses

loans.name: Daniel Ezequiel

texts.es: Don Daniel un agricultor de toda la vida, con los creditos anteriores a mantenido sus cultivos de Pitahaya, Piña y hortalizas como Ayote, pipian, etc. gracias a sus cosecha su familia a salido a delante. pero con este temporal de lluvia la cosecha tiende a llenarse de plagas e insectos por lo que se aconseja darle manteniento al cultivo, el señor Daniel con este nuevo financiamiento ademas de manteniento establesera 2 manzanas de Piña por lo que necesita de Fertilizantes e insumos adecuados para el desarrollo idoneo y optimo del producto, tambien invertira en la compra de hijos de Piña para sembrar y cultivar. Agradece el apoyo incondicional que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Daniel has been a farmer his whole life. With the previous loans he has maintained his crops of dragonfruit, pineapple, vegetables such as ayote and pipian (types of squash), etc. Thanks to his harvests the family has moved forward in life. But with this rainy season the harvest tends to become infested with pests and insects, so crop maintenance is recommended.

With the new loan, besides doing maintenance, Daniel will plant two manzanas (3.5 acres) of pineapple, so he needs fertilizers and adequate supplies for the optimal development of the crop. 

He will also purchase pineapple seedlings to plant and cultivate. He is grateful for the staunch support that Afodenic and Kiva have provided him.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is married with 3 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Deboloc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Sylvia sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients for snacks to sell.

Sylvia has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Sylvia hopes to have more savings for capital.

loans.use: to pay for flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients for snacks to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 62 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 3 children. 
Lolita has a pig-raising business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Lolita hopes to have success in her business.

loans.use: to pay for feed and vitamins for her pigs.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: La Señora Dionicia, es una persona de 38 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, alcanzo estudiar hasta la primaria, vive en su propia casa en la comunidad de Tiraque, tiene cinco dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos, La actividad económica de la Señora Dionicia es la producción agrícola, que en promedio anualmente manifiesta que realiza la venta de los siguientes productos y en las cantidades siguientes: Papa 80 cargas, Haba (verde) 60 cargas, Trigo (Grano) 2 cargas Cebada (Grano) 3 cargas, Oca 20 cargas. La siembra de estos cultivos lo realiza en sus propios terrenos agrícolas en una superficie de 1 hectárea y en sus terrenos heredados por sus padres en una superficie de 2 hectáreas los terrenos se hallan situados en la misma comunidad los cuales cuentan con riego. Vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo que realiza es para  la compra abono de gallinaza y compra semilla de papa y agroquímicos y así con la producción  en el futuro mejorara sus condiciones económicos y por tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Dionicia is 38 years old and is single. She studied through primary school. She lives in her own house in the community of Tiraque. She has her five children her charge and they are all economically dependent on her. Dionicia's business is agricultural production. She explains that in a year she usually sells the following products, in the following quantities: Poatoes - 80 cargas [a unit of weight]; fava beans (green) - 60 cargas; wheat - 2 cargas; barley - 3 cargas; oca [a small tuber similar to a potato] - 20 carga. She plants these crops on her own land of about 1 hectare and on land she inherited from her parents of about 2 hectares. The pieces of land are located in the same community and they have irrigation. She lives in a rustic adobe house. With this loan she will buy chicken manure, seed potatoes, and agricultural chemicals. With future production she will improve her economic conditions and also the quality of life for her dependents.

loans.use: to buy chicken manure, seed potatoes, and agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 37 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. Juanita works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan to purchase an engine. Juanita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Juanita hopes to have new pumpboat for fishing.

loans.use: to pay for an engine

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 26-year-old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a bakery alongside motorcycle transport in order to earn a living. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital to meet his customers' demands are his greatest challenges while his dream is to own a bakery that supplies bread to all the major towns of the country. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy baking flour to use in his bakery.

loans.use: to buy baking flour to use in his bakery.

loans.name: Ronak's Group

texts.en:
