Ronak is a member of this group from Iraq. Ronak is 53 years old, married and has two children. She is a primary school teacher with 27 years of experience in this job. Ronak has a smart 23-year-old son named Sherko. He always get high grades in school.

The family lived in Baghdad, but as a result of the violence, bombing and death there, the family ran away to the north and became IDP's and lost everything including dropping out of school to pay for their basic needs. Ronak felt terrible because she knew that her son's education is his weapon to have a decent chance of a better future but at the same time her salary and additional expenses as a result of becoming an IDP were not enough to pay for her son’s education.
 
The family faced a problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the school year for the additional expenses that are needed to cover the children's fees, school uniforms and books. With this loan now they can accommodate all these expenses. Sherko's vision is to complete his college education and work to help his IDP family. The story of Sherko is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients that are able to get a better education. 

Both of the borrowers in this group are taking the loan to pay for their son's education. They prefer to have their face altered for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб родился в 1994 года. Он не женат и и живет с родителями. Он является студентом 2 курса Экономического Университета Таджикистана по специальности Экономист. Он учится успешно и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Сухроб часто посещает библиотеку. Он начитанный молодой человек. Сухроб должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Suhrob was born in 1994. He is not married and lives with his parents. He is a student in the second course at the Economic University of Tajikistan specializing to be an Economist. He studies successfully and actively participates in the social life of the university. Suhrob often visits the library. He began to read at a young age. Suhrob needs to pay for his studies, but he doesn't have enough money. He is requesting a loan to pay the training contract. He waits on your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for study at the university

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 23 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and grandmother. Her grandmother is provided with a retirement pension. Salome and her husband are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where watermelon, eggplant, cabbage, and maize are grown. They always have high quality products, which are sold to local retailers at a good price. 

Because the family has only seasonal income, Salome decided to start a shoe-trading business and seek credit among local financial institutions. However, her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The Startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to receive a loan of $2000. With the credit, Salome will purchase a stock of shoes and then resell them at a good price. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell among her friends and villagers. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Thanks to the the Startup program Salome will be able to make savings and provide a better future for herself and her family.

loans.use: to begin trade in the shoe industry.

loans.name: Hafez

texts.en:
Hafez is a 29-year-old married man who has been living in Haja, Yemen. He earns a livelihood by being involved in a stationery business which has been in operation for many years. 

His story began with his own initiative. He worked for his brother`s stationary then he was able to save an amount to establish his business. He did all of the work himself, with no set hours, and he had some difficulties to overcome. 

In order to stabilize this business and compete against other entrepreneurs doing the same business, he needs sufficient funds to refill his stock of merchandise to continually operate his business smoothly. Consequently, He decided to take out a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to purchase books, gifts, and other stationary items to maintain and satisfy his customers. 

He hopes that he’ll develop his business successfully in the following years and be able to expand it and have it become larger.

loans.use: to purchase books, gifts, and other stationary items to maintain and satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 33-year-old married woman with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is involved in making bricks, a business that is commonly reserved for men but her ambition made her venture into the business and she has since reaped tangible benefits. Limited water supply and lack of enough labor is her major challenge while her dream is to produce on a large scale since the market is assured. Margret intends to use the loan to make more bricks.

loans.use: to make more bricks.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
This is Mary Joy. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more foam needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy more foam needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Joy hopes that her business will continue to grow, and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more foam needed in her foam-beds making business.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 30 años y vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa. Es padre de 2 pequeños de 9 años y de 9 meses, a quienes quiere mucho y por ello trabaja muy duro en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, Cesar trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes en el día; Cesar cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es amable con los clientes.

Cesar agradeceré el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para sus clientes como arroz, azúcar, fideos al por mayor, entre otros, así podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y luchar en busca de hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un gran taller de costura”.
texts.en:
Cesar is 30 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa. He is the father of two little ones, 9 years old and nine months old, whom he loves very much and for whose sake he works very hard in his small business selling groceries and drinks. 

Cesar works around nine hours a day and can serve up to 25 customers in a day. Cesar believes that he is succeeding with his business because he is friendly with the customers. 

Cesar is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders are providing him, as thanks to the help he has been offered, he will be able to buy merchandise for his customers, such as rice, sugar and noodles at wholesale, as well as other products. This way he will be able to offer better service to his customers, which will allow him to improve his income and strive toward making his dream a reality: "To have a large sewing workshop".

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Luqman

texts.en:
Luqman is 24 years old, single and lives in Ibb, Yemen. He lives in harsh conditions and has to work so that he can improve his living conditions without the help of others. He has been running a stationery business for the past 5 years.  He has the determination to work and get ahead to continue making progress in life. He works hard to generate the necessary income to cover expenses.

Currently, he has requested a youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to buy stationery and accessories in order to diversify the products he offers to his customers. By doing so, he hopes that his business will increase its sales considerably. He hopes to get married and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy stationery and accessories in order to diversify the products he offers to his customers.

loans.name: Lucina Melissa

texts.es:
Lucina tiene 33 años, es una joven carismática y sobre todo con ganas de salir adelante, Lucina logro estudiar la carrera de obstetricia, pero debido a que no encontraba empleo y tenía muchos problemas económicos ella inicio su negocio de compra y venta de chatarra, Lucina trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes al día; Lucina cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque atiende a sus clientes de manera amable y sobre todo con respeto.

Lucina agradece el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar más chatarra y también realizar mejoras en su vivienda, ya que comprar madera, calamina, clavos, entre otros para arreglar el techo de la vivienda; así ella seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Mejorar su negocio cada día”.
texts.en:
Lucina is 33 years old. She is a charismatic young woman who above all has a desire to get ahead. Lucina was able to study for a career as a midwife, but because she couldn’t find work and had a lot of economic problems, she started her own business buying and selling scrap metal. 

Lucina works around 9 hours per day, and she can have up to 25 customers in a day. Lucina believes that she is moving forward with her business because she treats her customers in a kind - and above all, respectful - manner. 

Lucina is grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders are offering her, because thanks to this, she will be able to purchase more scrap metal. She will also make improvements on her home by purchasing wood, corrugated iron, and nails, among other items, to redo her house’s roof. In this way, she will continue fighting to make her greatest dream a reality: “To improve her business every day”.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal, corrugated iron, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is at the age of 34, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is married and has two sons. Her husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business to have a regular income for the family. He is running a business of manufacturing and selling furniture, such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business over 10 years ago.
 
Saira stays at home and looks after his sons and old parents. She had previously obtained loans for his business, he adds a 3rd loan to add to his selection of made furniture. Today, her husband has many regular customers. 

This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to expand his business. This is why he came to BRAC Pakistan, and wishes to obtain a loan to buy raw materials such as planks, chip boards, nails, etc. for marking furniture.
 
She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for the business of her husband and for her family.
She says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as planks, glue, chip boards, nails, etc. for making furniture to sell.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy more grocery items for it. Her income from business helped in her family's everyday expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eufemia hopes to be successful in life and business, and dreams that her children will find good jobs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Lauro

texts.en:
Lauro is 44 years old and from the municipality of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with three children ages 11, 15 and 18. Lauro farms rice, vegetables and coconut for an income. He works hard for his family's needs. Lauro is determined to make sure that his children have a better life than his.

Lauro is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings that will help him in maintaining his crops.

In the future, he hopes to see his children be successful in their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings

loans.name: Corazon Valiente Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está integrado por jóvenes que quieren empezar a emprender una actividad, para que de esa forma puedan sentirse útiles y ayudar con los gastos de la casa.                                         La señorita Yeny es una de la integrantes, ella es presidenta  del grupo se dedica a la venta de ropa también ayuda a su mama en la venta de remedios naturales, la venta lo realizan desde su casa, algunos días salen a hacer sus ventas en forma ambulante para tener mejores resultado con su venta. Por medio de su esfuerzo por salir adelante ella va logrando mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Pide de este crédito  para la compra de ropas de variadas clases para poder seguir trabajando y luchando por salir adelante. Agradece por la oportunidad que siendo jóvenes están recibiendo. En la foto del grupo aparecen los titulares y algunos de loa codeudores que siempre les apoyan y que también son firmantes.
texts.en:
This group is made up of young adults that want to start working.  By so doing, they will be able to feel useful and help out with their household expenses.

Yeny is a member of this group.  She is the president of the group and works selling clothes.  In addition, she helps her mother sell natural remedies.  She sells from her house and sometimes leaves to sell as a street vendor so as to achieve greater success with her sales.  Through her efforts to progress, she is improving her and her family's quality of life.

She is asking for this loan to buy various types of clothes.  In this way, she can keep working and get ahead in life.  She is grateful for this opportunity that they are receiving as young adults.  The group photo includes Yeny along with her fellow members who consistently support her and who are also co-signers.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: José es originario de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la actividad de pesca desde hace tiempo. Está agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito con el apoyo que le han brindado a través del financiamiento anterior, ya que logro invertir en herramientas con las cuales realiza esta actividad. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar un trasmallo con el fin de reemplazar el que tiene ya que se encuentra en mal estado. Cuenta con el apoyo de un amigo, quien le brinda un espacio donde puede realizar la actividad con mayor seguridad. Estima que al adquirir el préstamo podrá obtener un buen equipo de pesca  y mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José is originally from the city of Granada.  He is a merchant and has worked as a fisherman for a long time.  He thanks Kiva and MiCredito for the support that they gave him in his previous loan, since he was able to buy tools that he uses in his work.

He is asking for this new loan to buy a trammel (fishing net) so he can replace the one that he has, since it is in bad condition now.  He has the support of a friend who has given him a space to carry out his business with better security.  He believes that by obtaining this loan, he will be able to obtain good catches of fish and therefore better income.

loans.use: buy a trammel (fishing net).

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia, es padre de 5 hijos y junto a su esposa se esfuerzan mucho para poder salir adelante junto a su familia. Augusto para poder llevar un plato de comida a su hogar trabaja como vigilante en una institución de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 12 horas al día, es un poco cansado ya que tiene que estar de pie todo el tiempo que dura su jornada de labore, augusto cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Augusto está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá implementar un kiosko de venta de abarrotes, el comprara arroz, fideos, atún, entre otros para que su esposa pueda trabajar y con ello poder tener un ingreso extra para solventar los gastos del hogar, así el seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Construir su vivienda de material noble ya que actualmente es de madera y darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Augusto lives in the city of Aguaytia, is the father of 5 children, and tries very hard with his wife to get ahead with their family.  Augusto works 12 hours a day as a security guard at a facility in his city.  It is somewhat tiring work, since he has to work standing up for his entire shift.  Augusto thinks that his work is going well for him because he is responsible.

Augusto is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to establish a stand to sell groceries at their house.  He will buy rice, noodles, tuna, and other things.  In this way, his wife will be able to work and they can obtain some extra income to help with the household expenses.

In this way, he will continue striving towards his dream of building a house with good materials (currently, it is made of wood).  In addition, he wants to give his children the opportunity to obtain professional jobs.

loans.use: set up a stand to sell groceries.

loans.name: Getrudis

texts.es:
Doña Getrudis tiene 42 años de edad con un grado de educación de secundaria cursado hasta el segundo año por lo que no pudo continuar estudiando ya que tomo la decisión de casarse joven por consecuencia años después vinieron los hijos. Su esposo es agricultor el cual aprendió gracias a sus padres especializándose en el cultivo de café junto a sus esposa y sus hijos. Su familia está compuesta por 5 hijos los cuales el mayor vive en EE.UU el cual ayuda con remesas a sus padres, el segundo tiene 20 años y curso hasta el segundo de comercio, posteriormente dejo de asistir al colegio y decidió ayudar a sus padres con las diferentes actividades en el campo, el tercero tiene 16 años y está estudiando un curso de mecánica, el cuarto tiene 14 años y estudia en la secundaria en tercero de ciclo, y la menor es una niña quien tiene 13 años y está en la primaria en sexto grado la cual termina este año, con ellos también vive la nuera esposa del hijo que está en los EE.UU. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que tiene 12 años de dedicarse al desarrollo de dichas actividades pero también cultivan maíz, frijoles, plátano, etc. lo cual ayuda en la economía de su hogar.

Su meta principal es hacer unos arreglos que su casa de habitación necesita y que son necesarios para la comodidad de su familia como un piso, un buen techo entre otros que son necesarios. Pero su sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales graduados de carreras universitarias que den salidas y soluciones a sus necesidades. Por lo que hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café y poder sembrar la nueva chapola para seguir extendiendo sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Getrudis is 42 years old.  She has a second-grade education and wasn't able to continue it because she married when she was young.  Soon after, she began having children.  Her husband is a farmer who, with the help of his wife and children, specializes in growing coffee.  He learned to farm from his parents.  

Getrudis' family includes 5 children, the oldest of which lives in the United States.  He helps his family by sending his parents money.  Her second son is 20 years old and completed secondary school in trade but then decided not to attend high school in favor of helping his parents with their farming endeavors.  Her third son is 16 years old and is studying to be a mechanic.  Her fourth son is 14 years old and is in his third year of secondary school.  Her youngest child is their 13-year-old daughter who is in her 6th year old primary school and will finish this year.  In addition, the wife of their oldest son lives with them.  

Getrudis is very experienced with farming, having spent 12 years doing it.  In addition to coffee, her family grows corn, beans, bananas, etc.  This helps them with the household expenses.

Her main goal is to make some much-needed repairs to their house such as a floor, a good roof, and other things that are necessary.  Her dream, however, is that her children become graduate from college and obtain professional jobs that let them fulfill their needs.

For this reason, she is asking for a loan that she will use to buy farming supplies that she will use to help grow her coffee crop and also tend to her young coffee plants that she will plant in the future and thus expand her crop.

loans.use: buy farming supplies so she can tend to her coffee crop as well as her young coffee plants that she will plant.

loans.name: Yara Group

texts.en:
Diana is the featured borrower of Yara group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Diana is a 37-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working in the mouneh (traditional food preservation) business for three years. She started this business to help her husband cover their family's increasing expenses. Diana is a hard worker with a very good reputation in her region. She provides good products to her customers and shows cleanliness during her work.

Diana is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special seasonal products to conserve for the coming seasons, and to start preparing her homemade food.

Diana is the lady at the center of the picture. As for the other group members, Akaber is the lady standing at the left side of the picture, and Awatef is at the right side with a black top.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special seasonal products to conserve for the coming seasons, and to start preparing her homemade food

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es: Maria Trinidad tiene 54 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la crianza de animales menores como pollos, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollitos,  ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Maria Trinidad is 54 years old and lives in the community of Sunchubamba, which is in Paucartambo Province. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who wants to move her family forward. Through her work efforts, she manages a business of raising small animals, such as chickens.  Maria Trinidad is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Tres Cruces de Oro” (Three Crosses of Gold). 

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more chicks. Maria Trinidad appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Doña Josefina, tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en una comunidad que pertenece a San Francisco de Yojoa. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio y a la agricultura. Cuenta con una finca donde produce café, plátanos, pimienta gorda y frijoles. Para el cultivo le ayudan sus hijos y la producción que sacan la venden en el mercado local de la zona. La principal producción es el café. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar el fertilizante necesario para mejorar el cultivo de café y mantenerlo en buen estado. Con esta inversión espera aumentar el cultivo y las ventas. Su plan es enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar bien la agricultura y poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Josefina, 52, is a widow and has three children which whom she lives. They live in a community that belongs to San Francisco Yojoa. She has always made her living at business and agriculture. She has a farm where she grows coffee, plantains, allspice and beans. Through her crops she helps her children. What they produce they take to the local market and sell. The main product is coffee. 

She has applied for this second loan for 15,000 Lempiras, with which she is going to buy the necessary fertilizer to improve the coffee crop and maintain it in good condition. With this investment she hopes to increase the crop and its sale. Her plan is to train her children to work well in agriculture and to be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies for her coffee farm.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta tiene 67 años, está en pareja  hace varios años, tiene una  hija. La señora Jacinta tiene una despensa, tiene local propio, casa propia, es una persona bastante luchadora que supo salir adelante por medio de su esfuerzo.
Se inició teniendo un copetín, y después cambió de rubro, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya bien formada por su antigüedad en el rubro.
Solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo, ya que quiere poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, bebidas, comestibles y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando e invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Jacinta is 67 years old and has been with her common-law partner for several years.  She has one daughter.  

Sra. Jacinta has a food pantry that is set up in her own shop, which is located in her house.  She is a determined individual who has been able to get ahead through her own efforts.  Jacinta started out operating a snack bar, but she later changed businesses.  Today she is doing well.  Her clientele is well-established because of her experience in this trade.  

Jacinta is requesting a loan to use as operating capital.  She wants to invest in the purchase of vegetables, beverages, food products, and other items.  This will enable her to continue working and investing in her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beverages, food products, and other items.

loans.name: Dariko

texts.en:
Dariko is 46 years old, and she lives with her family in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region. Dariko has two children. Her son now is in the Russian Federation for work abroad, and her daughter studies at the Yerevan State Medical University at the paid division. Her husband works as a locksmith.  Dariko also has higher education; she has graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute. For many years, she has worked at the school as a teacher of mathematics, and now she has become the deputy director of the same school.
 
Dariko asks a loan of 450,000 Armenian drams in order to pay her daughter’s tuition fee, since no matter how hard they try to work, they do not manage to both pay for their daughter's education and provide their family with normal living conditions.

loans.use: To pay her daughter’s tuition fee.

loans.name: Orhontuul

texts.en: Mrs. Orhontuul is 46 years old and lives with her husband and a son in a ger, the traditional nomadic tent, on a rented plot of land in Arhangai province of Mongolia. She and her husband, Otgonbayar, have been providing firewood as a sales business in the local market since 2008. They purchase bulk timber and chop it down to a suitable size for those in Mongolian gers and houses to burn in their stove. They sell in the rental area of a local market and have been saving for purchasing a plot of land of their own and building a small house for the family. She is now requesting 800,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase bulk timber to sell on a retail basis to clients. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase bulk timber to sell on a retail basis to clients.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Kadiatu from Kambia, northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 years and 25 years. She also has two relatives at home. In 2010, Kadiatu established her stationery business. She began her business because she wants to create income to support her children. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the price inflation of goods.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more pens, books, rulers and pencils for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and repay her loan. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pens, books, rulers and pencils for resale.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini is married and has four children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the 35,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase three sacks of dried fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid lives in Punjab, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. For the past many years, he has been running a cloth shop. He sells a variety of unstiched cloth in various colors in his shop. This shop is the only source of income for his family. He belongs to a poor family, and his monthly income is insufficient to meet the family needs. He is the only earning person in the family who has to pay for all the bills. All of his income goes for paying bills; due to this, he can't save any amount of income for urgent and future needs.

Currently, he is going through some serious issue. He wants to replace the current stock with the new variety, with the change in trends. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. As he doesn't have new variety to offer, this results in the decrease of the number of customers as well.

Rashid has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of new cloths to purchase from different areas and sell in the market at a profitable price.  

He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of colorful unstiched cloth to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the workers who will prune his coffee plants.

loans.name: Yufi

texts.en:
Mrs Yufi lives in Jakarta, a congested and polluted megacity with large drinking water problems.  This is, in her own words, what she is doing to solve them: 
“In May this year (2013) I met with the founders of Nazava Water Filters. I am very impressed and appreciate all the efforts of them and the rest of the Nazava team to provide a way for people to get clean, cheap and healthy water to the people of Indonesia. 
I am interested in the background, philosophy and goal of their company, namely make the lives of especially poor people better, easier and healthier, therefore I dared to dive into promoting Nazava products. 
I see that Nazava Water Filters are a way out for the Indonesian people, especially those that live far from cities to be able to access safe drinking water in an affordable way so that in the end they will have a better and more productive life. 
Besides providing safe and clean water, Nazava also forms an opportunity for people to own an enterprise because Nazava provides opportunities to everyone to become a re-seller in Indonesia. As such they can eventually create new job opportunities as well. 
I already contracted 8 agents to work in the greater Jakarta Area, than because this is such an enormous urban region with over 14 million people, I will need to add some more.  I see a great opportunity for this product in Indonesia. Because of that I have started to do business in other provinces as well like Bali. “
In order to enable Mrs. Yufi to meet her ambitions she is in need of more stock. With this loan she can purchase around 200 filters which will provide safe drinking water to around 1000 people.

loans.use: to provide safe drinking water to over 1000 people in Jakarta, Indonesia

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman who is 44 years old with three children ages 23, 21 and 16. .She is a tailor and has done this since 2008. Tailoring is her sole source of income and she works nine hours on average per day. The business is located in Bugongi town cell in the Sheema district and she began the business with the purpose of having a clear source of income. Her clients are mainly the local people in the area where she operates the business. She hopes to use the loan funds (1,500,000 UGX) to buy cloth material, which she intends to use to make clothing to sell at a profit. Her biggest challenge is competition but she believes that with the profits from the business, she will be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing

loans.name: Cecilia Maria

texts.es: Cecilia Maria vive en la ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura pues siembra piñas, plátanos, hoja de coca, yuca, arroz, achote y otras cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y insecticidas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Cecilia Maria lives in the city of Patria in the District of Kosñipata, which is in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.  Her main business activity is farming.  Cecilia grows pineapples, bananas, coca leaves, cassava, rice, annatto, and other crops.  

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy compost and insecticides.  Cecilia appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy compost and insecticides.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 49 years of age and the mother of four children. Her son owns an electrical shop in which he sells electrical stabilizers and provides repair services for the stabilizers. He does not have enough customers who want to troubleshoot the stabilizers after disorder. Mostly the customers like to buy new stabilizers. He wants to buy new stabilizers according to the demand but does not have sufficient savings to do so.

Therefore, Nusrat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will become empowered to buy stabilizers for resale. In addition, he wants to buy some extra electric switches, bulbs, bulb holders, sockets etc.

Nusrat says thank you to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy electrical stablizers for resale.

loans.name: Mahawa

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Mahawa from Kambia in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of 15 and 30 years old. She also has two relatives at home. In 1999, Mahawa established her retail business. She began this business to improve her children.  She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mahawa requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and soap powder for her soap business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and repay her loan. In the future, Mahawa plans expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and soap powder for her soap business.

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en: Zviad is 41 years old. He lives in a small village in the Zestaponi district of western Georgia with his mother and a son. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Zviad has a secondary education and he and his son are unemployed now. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of income and live in poverty.  According to the above-mentioned situation, Zviad lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require a stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of $1,800. With the received loan, Zviad will purchase a minibus and start trading fruits and vegetables. He is going to purchase them in the Kakheti region of eastern Georgia and transport them with the minibus to resell in the Zestaponi district. His main clients will be his villagers. This credit will help him support his family. Zviad is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus to trade fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is 38 years old and married with five children between the ages of 5 and 19 years old, three of whom are going to school. She runs a palm oil business in the Kambia northern area, in Sierra Leone. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income to support the home.

She's been in this business since 2004 and sells palm oil at her house. She does not have any source of income except her business. She says that at present, her business is doing well because she is able to feed her children out of the profit.

Ramatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and take care of her children's welfare. In the future, she would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Ayissogbe Group

texts.fr: AYISSOGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Colette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Colette n’a pas fréquenté l’école et est mariée à un certain Martin. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Colette, pour subvenir aux besoins des enfants, confectionne depuis près dix ans, des gâteaux (à base de farine de blé) qu’elle vend à son domicile. Colette s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Colette désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Colette sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYISSOGBE. Les crédits précédemment consentis ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Ayissogbe is a three-person group whose members live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Colette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old. 

Colette did not go to school and is married to Martin. The couple has four dependent children - some of whom go to school.  The couple lives with their children and takes care of the household expenses together. 

In order to meet the needs of her children, Colette has been baking wheat flour cakes and selling them out of her home for nearly 10 years.  

Colette gets her supplies in a city in Benin. With the goal of growing her business and being more competitive on the market, Colette would like to increase her stock of supplies. This will allow her to grow her turnover and revenues. 

For this reason, Colette and the other members of the Ayissogbe group, are  requesting another loan with ALIDé. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: buy wheat flour and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria vive en la ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, patos, chanchos pero también se dedica a la agricultura pues siembra piñas, plátanos, hoja de coca, yuca, arroz, achote y otras cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas y chanchos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Gloria lives in the city of Patria in the District of Kosñipata, which is in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru. Her main business activity is raising small animals such as chickens, ducks, and pigs.  She also engages in farming by cultivating pineapples, bananas, coca leaves, cassava, rice, annatto, and other crops.   

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy chickens and pigs.  Gloria appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en: Nyevu is a hardworking woman who strives hard to meet the basic needs of her family members. She runs a business selling coconuts to her fellow villagers and neighbours. Here again she comes to you requesting  a loan of KES 50,000 to add to her stock of coconuts to sell. She thanks Yehu and Kiva at large for the support.

loans.use: to add to her stock of coconuts to sell

loans.name: Ife Sowakpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE SOWAKPO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. Le représentant de ce groupe nommé Justin, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. Justin n'a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la couture. Justin est âgé de 32 ans et est marié à Baïra. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Justin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges de la famille. Il y a environs quinze ans que Justin exerce sa profession de couturier. Parallèlement, Justin vend des fournitures de couture et des cartes de recharge téléphoniques. Justin s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de la clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Justin sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits obtenus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The IFE SOWAKPO group is composed of three persons living in the same village, and belonging to the same savings group. The representative of the group, Justin, can be seen in the photo with his hand raised. Justin never attended school, but learned how to sew. He is 32 years old and married to Baïra. They have three children, some of whom attend school. The couple lives with their children and, together, take care of the various family needs. Justin has been involved in sewing for about 15 years. In parallel, he also sells sewing materials and SIM cards for mobile phones. He stocks up on materials in a big city in Benin. In order to better satisfy his customer requests and in order to increase his sales, Justin is asking for his fourth loan from ALIDE. The previous loans were all successfully reimbursed.

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials and SIM cards for mobile phones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Mehmooda

texts.en:
Mehmooda is a 45-year old married woman, living with her spouse and 4 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She belongs to a happy family because her husband earns sufficient income to meet their daily household expenses. 
Her husband has been running a generator repair shop for many years in a nearby town. He is very professional and experienced in his work. There are a lot of problems in the area due to electricity load shedding and most people like to use generators to produce electricity. Because the generators are used continously they break down more often. This is the reason he has many customers. Her husband is very hard working and honest, he charges very low service charges for his services, that is why people like him to repair their generators. 
Her husband wants to buy spare generator parts and tools but he does not have sufficient savings to spend on purchases because he recently spent his savings on an emergency need.
Therefore, Mehmooda requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy his desired spare parts and tools for repairing. 
Mehmooda hopes that now more customers will be attracted toward his shop to increase their income.
Mehmooda thanks the lenders and Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools and spare parts to repair generators

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO est composé de quatre personnes qui vivent dans la même zone. C'est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pierrette est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Hounsoutonou. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés, et vivant à leur charge. Pierrette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Grâce aux revenus de son activité, Pierrette arrive à apporter un aide au mari dans les diverses charges du ménage. Depuis cinq ans, Pierrette vend des condiments et des vivres (maïs, huile de palme) dans sa région. Pierrette s’approvisionne au Bénin.  Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pierrette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO, un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The GBENONKPO group is composed of four persons living in the same neighborhood. This is the sixth time the group is asking for financial support from ALIDE, in order to increase their level of commercial activity. The representative of the group, Pierrette, can be seen with her hand raised in the photo. Pierrette is 50 years old and married to an farmer name Hounsoutonou. The couple have four children, all of whom attend school. Pierrette lives with her husband and their children. Sales stemming from her activity allows her to help her husband in supporting the diverse needs of their family. For the past five years, Pierrette has been selling condiments and staple food supplies (corn, palm oil, etc) in her region. She stocks up on materials in Benin. In order to better satisfy for customers and to increase her sales and profits, Pierrette is asking, along with the other members of the GBENONKPO group, for a loan from ALIDE. All previously received loans were successfully reimbursed.

loans.use: Purchase corn and palm oil

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO est un groupe de cinq personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, Victorine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 55 ans et est mariée à Paul, un cultivateur. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Victorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Victorine assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de quatre ans, Victorine produit de la farine de manioc qu’elle vend dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Victorine vend de l’huile de palme. Victorine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Victorine et les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: JESUKPEGO is a group composed of five persons all living in the same village. The representative of the groupm Victorine (seen with her hand raised in the photo), is 55 years old and married to Paul, a farmer. The couple have five children, some of whom attend school, and all of whom are under their responsibility. Victorine lives with her husband and her children. She, along with her husband, cover the various family needs. For nearly four years, Victorine has been making manioc flour that she sells in her area. She also sells palm oil. Victorine stocks up on materials in the region of Benin. This is the first time that Victorine and the members of the JESUKPEGO group ask for financial support from ALIDE, in order to reinforce their working capital and increase the level of commercial activity, to better respond to customer requests.

loans.use: Purchase manioc and palm oil

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 44 years old, she lives in an airport community. She has a 9th grade education and she is married with six children between the ages of 3 and 24. They all live with her and attend school. For the past ten years she been selling rice, oil, charcoal, and plastic bags. Problem that she facing is goods shortages. She likes her business because it provide for the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, charcoal and plastic bags for her business, Her plan is to provide education for her children and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, charcoal and plastic bags for her business,

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Isata from Kambia, in the Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 5 children. Three of her children are currently attending school.  

Isata runs a food stand within her community where she sells rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. She says that the main challenge for her business is transportation problems. 

Isata has requested a loan in order to buy, rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy, rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia, aged 32, is a married woman. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Her husband is a laborer who earns daily wages.She has been sewing cloths since her marriage because her husband's income is not enough to sustain the family.
She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and people in the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 
Recently her sewing machine sustained water damage which broke some of the parts. She tried to fix the problem but it still is not in working order.
To help her continue her business, she has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increase in demand. 
In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to pay for personal expenses.
Fozia is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира живет и работает в городе Вахдат, который находится рядом с городом Душанбе, столицей Таджикистана. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем и является матерью двоих детей. Они маленькие, еще ходят в садик. Муж Муниры находится на заработках заграницей. Мунира живет в доме у мужа вместе со свекровью. Она более семи лет занимается шитьем платьев. Раньше она работала дома, воспитывала детей, присматривала за скотом и одна трудилась на грядке. Сейчас она работает портнихой в ателье. Мунира хочет купить новую швейную машину. По этой причине она нуждается в кредите. Если она купит швейную машину, она сможет с экономить рабочее время, шить два платья в день и таким образом заработать и сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Munira lives and works in Vahdat which is near Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She's 27 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. They are small, still in kindergarten. Munira's husband is working abroad. Munira lives with her mother-in-law in her husband's house. She has more than seven years of experience sewing dresses. Previously, she worked at home, raising children, looking after cattle, and keeping her garden all by herself. She now works as a seamstress in a studio. Munira wants to buy a new sewing machine. Therefore, she needs a loan. If she buys a sewing machine she can sew two dresses in a day. This will allow her to make enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine so she can make enough money to renovate her house before winter.

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Amarjargal is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife Shinehuu is currently unemployed and stays at home taking care of the family. 

His two sons and daughter attend local schools. He lived in the countryside, breeding livestock until 2010. He started his taxi service business in town in 2010 with a second-hand Korean car, and have already built a regular client base. 

He is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy a better car to continue providing a taxi service business to provide a better living for his family. He is a hardworking, diligent and positive person.

loans.use: to buy a better car to continue providing taxi service business and provide a better living for his family.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Salamatu from Kambia, in the northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 4 children. She also has two relatives at home. In 2010, Salamatu established her retail business. She began her business because she did not go to school and has some training in business.  She works at the business 12 hours a day, 7 days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is inflation of goods.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and cooking season. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and repay her loan. In the future, Salamatu plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. He is married and he lives with his wife, school-aged daughter, his mother and his brother’s family. 

Karen has a higher education in engineering. For several years Karen has worked at the company which specializes in refrigerator repairing. Since 2009 Karen has become the director of the same company. 

Karen asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Drams to buy a car, which you can see in photo, for his own use.

loans.use: buy a car

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en: Luiza is a farmer from the village of Nor-Kharberd of Ararat region. Her family consists of her mother, husband and four school age children (two sons and two daughters). Farming is the only source of income of the family. Luiza breeds pigs and piglets, and cultivates potatoes and beets. As Luiza's large family's needs are growing, she wants to enlarge the livestock a little bit to be able to cover the needs of her family more effectively. A loan of USD 2500 will be a huge support to the family and will enable them to purchase pigs and turkeys, to buy some forage for the pigs and to renovate the greenhouse. Luiza and her family will highly appreciate the lenders support in helping them to collect the needed amount of loan.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and turkeys, to buy some forage for the pigs and to renovate the greenhouse

loans.name: Bahtishahe

texts.en:
Bahtishahe thanks all Kiva lenders for making her plans for her home and future a reality. She used the loan to solve the problems with her bathroom, buying a water heater and other essential fixtures for renovating and repairing the bathroom. By addressing these hygiene and basic need issues, she managed to improve the health of her family and their living conditions which has always been her goal. She claims that without the loan she never would have been able to do the renovations because of the small amount of income she earns. She is hoping that this renovation lasts for a very long time and she will not have any further need to redo or fix up things again in that area. Bahtishahe still works as a seamstress and her husband continue working in Italy to support his family.

Now she is requesting a second loan, this time  for renovating rooms in her house, so that she will be able to finally complete her home. She wants to thank again all of the lenders for both loans, which have helped her to achieve her dream. "I will never have chance to accomplish my goals without this support" said Bahtishahe. She is very happy for this second opportunity to improve life conditions.

loans.use: To renovate rooms in her house

loans.name: Muhamet

texts.en:
Muhamet is an Egyptian and he is on disability income. Kindly note that there are a high number of ethnic Egyptians who, due to their totally unhealthy living conditions in the past and some in the present, have been experiencing health problems; Muhamet is one of them unfortunately. His wife though works in a dental laboratory as a cleaner, and she brings home an income.

Muhamet has been photographed at their house where the couple lives, including their children, 17 and 14, who are attending public school.
 
Muhamet is seeking your attention to help him financially so that he does some home repairs with this loan before the cold winters kicks in. “ It is leaking everywhere and the wind and cold comes in,” is what Muhamet said.

loans.use: to repair his family home shown in the photograph before the cold winter comes in.

loans.name: Roberto Nolasco

texts.es:
Roberto de 65 años,  en su infancia estudio hasta 4º grado, ya que sus padres le dijeron que tenia que trabajar para ayudar a la familia que era de nueve hermanos, es casado desde que tenia 22 años, es padre de familia de dos hijas de 27 y 37 años de edad, la mayor reside en los Estados Unidos desde hace cuatro años, se fue al ver las necesidades que tiene la familia y para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos pequeños hijos quienes viven con don Roberto, la hija menor le ayuda a los oficios del hogar y trabaja un poco en la elaboración de hamacas.

Los padres de Roberto, le enseñaron el trabajo en la agricultura, los cultivos de mezcal y la crianza de ganado, sus dos pequeños nietos estudian en la comunidad  educación básica. Actualmente se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijoles, maicillo y la crianza de ganado. 

 Compra los insumos agrícolas en la ciudad, para ello debe abordar dos buses y es un trayecto de 40 minutos hasta llegar al destino, el ganado lo compra en el tiangue que esta a 30 minutos de camino, y tiene que pagar el viaje para que le lleven el ganado a los potreros.

Su hija, su esposa y los nietos siempre le están ayudando en el cuido del ganado, mientras él esta en los cultivos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para la compra dos vacas de $600.00 cada una,  las que comprara en el tiangue. El resto de dinero lo necesita para el arreglo de potreros, pues necesita cercar los terrenos, pues ahorita se le sale el ganado por que tiene el cerco de alambre en mal estado.

El crédito vendrá a beneficiar en gran medida al cliente, pues necesita incrementar el numero de ganado, para tener leche y sacar los derivados para la alimentación de la familia. Con ello asegurara la alimentación y también, en el futuro poder vender ganado y obtener mayores ingresos económicos.

Don Roberto, dentro de sus sueños esta seguir incrementando poco a poco su ganado y vender leche o sus derivados en la comunidad, pues es un rubro que conoce desde pequeño. Espera seguir con la salud que tiene de momento, para enseñarle a sus nietos los trabajos del campo, pues sus hijas ya son mayores. También, en el largo plazo desea repellar su vivienda con cemento y arena, pues su casa es de adobe y necesita algunas mejoras.
texts.en:
Roberto is 65 years old.  During his childhood, he studied through the fourth grade but his parents told him that he had to work in order to help the family since there were nine children.  Roberto got married at the age of 22 and he is the father of two daughters, ages 27 and 37.  The older daughter has been living in the United States for the past four years so that she can provide for the needs of her family and offer a better quality of life to her two young children who live with Don Roberto.  The younger daughter takes care of the household duties and earns a little bit of income by making hammocks.  

Roberto’s parents taught him how to work on a farm, in particular growing agave and raising cattle.  His two young grandchildren attend school in the community.  At the moment, Roberto grows corn, beans, and sorghum, in addition to raising cattle.  He buys his farming supplies in the city.  In order to do this, he must board two buses and travel 40 minutes in order to reach his destination.  He buys cattle at the street market that is located 30 minutes from the highway.  Roberto must pay for transportation costs in order to get the cattle to his pasture.  His daughter, wife, and grandchildren help with taking care of the cattle while he is busy looking after the crops.  

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy two cows worth $600 USD each at the street market.  The rest of the money will be used for repairs around his farm since he needs to enclose his land.  At the moment, the cattle are able to leave the property since the existing wire fence is in bad condition.  The money will be of great benefit to Roberto since he needs to increase the number of cattle in his herd so that he can produce milk and other products to feed his family.  Once he is assured that his family is taken care of, Roberto can sell the cattle in the future in hopes of earning more income.  

Among Don Roberto’s aspirations is to gradually increase his herd of cattle so that he can sell milk and other dairy products to the community since he has been in this trade from a young age.  He hopes to remain healthy so that he can teach his grandchildren how to farm since his daughters are already grown.  In the long term, he also wants to whitewash his house with cement and sand.  His house is made of adobe and in need of a few repairs.

loans.use: to buy two cows and to pay for repairs around his farm.

loans.name: Baasantsogt

texts.en:
Mr. Baasantsogt, 31 years old, lives with his sister in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. They live in a house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2005. 

His sister is unemployed currently and used to sell clothes by renting a stall in a trade center. He is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase equipment necessary for tire repair service. He is planning to employ his sister's husband to run the tire repair shop as he is busy rendering the taxi service. This new business will sure increase his income and improve his life.

loans.use: to purchase equipment necessary for tire repair service.

loans.name: Kanchaiym

texts.ru: Канчайым 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Канчайым - средне-специальное образование, работает в сельской школе преподавателем. Канчайым в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Канчайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Канчайым обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Канчайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kanchaiym is 54 years old, she is married and is raising five children together with her husband. Kanchaiym has specialized secondary education. She works as a teacher in the village school. As an additional source of income Kanchaiym does animal husbandry which she started eighteen years ago with the purchase of livestock for 4,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Kanchaiym now has one milk cow, one calf and eight sheep. Her monthly income is 8,500 som. With the goal to further grow her business Kanchaiym has come to the Microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy sheep to increase the headcount of livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Charlotte is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Charlotte is married and has four children. Her husband works as a petty trader. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Charlotte wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, Charlotte plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of charcoal, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.ru: Соне 57 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 2 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Сони - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сони, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Соня обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки коров. Доходы от кредита Соня планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины в будущем.
texts.en: Sonya is 57 years old, she is a widow and is raising two children as well as running her business. Sonya has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family she does animal husbandry which she started fourteen years ago with the purchase of livestock for 8,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Sonya now has one milk cow and fifteen heads of small horned cattle. Her monthly income is 15,000 som. With the goal to further grow her business Sonya has come to the Microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy cows to increase the headcount of livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of her livestock and also save money to buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 31-year-old married father of four children who has worked hard in repairing motorcycles for seventeen years to provide his children with a better future.
In 2010 he rented his current motorcycle repairing garage, and he is working hard to develop it as much as he can. Thus, for this reason, Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Developmen, to buy necessary car hardware to start repairing cars as an additional income business, which he believes will cover his children's increasingly unexpected needs.
Mohamad hopes to keep on developing his business to make sure he can reply to all of his customer's and family's needs as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy necessary car hardware to start repairing cars

loans.name: Alba Rosa

texts.es: Doña Alba tiene 39 años de edad, casada y madre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 5 años. Inicio su actividad vendiendo granos básicos, poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro establecer otros productos, lo cual ha sido de beneficio para su clientela y familia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien la apoya económicamente con los gastos del hogar. Solicita el crédito para comprar: pantalones, camisas y blusas nuevas con el fin de satisfacer a sus clientes. Estima que adquirir el crédito podrá obtener precios bajos ya que comprara al por mayor. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar. Su meta próxima es expandir su negocio y vender electrodomésticos ya que son productos de mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Alba is 39 years old and is married with 2 children. She has been in business for 5 years selling new clothing. She started her business selling bulk grains and gradually with a lot of effort and hard work she was able to introduce other products, which has been beneficial for her customers and her family. She gets help from her husband, who helps her financially with the household running costs. 

Alba is asking for the loan to buy new trousers, shirts and blouses, so she can satisfy her customers. She thinks that with the loan she will be able to get lower prices by buying wholesale. Her plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of her home. Her next goal is to expand her business and sell domestic electrical appliances since there is a lot of demand for these products.

loans.use: to buy new trousers, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Carmen Delia

texts.es: Carmen  es originaria de la ciudad de  Matagalpa. Tiene 27 años de edad, casada y madre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años. Inicio esta actividad junto al apoyo de sus padres, poco a poco estableció su propio negocio el cual ha sido su ayuda para el sustento de su familia. Comercializa sus productos en el mercado, ya que donde está ubicada es un área visitada por muchos consumidores. Tiene como expectativa mejorar la infraestructura de su local con el fin de brindar una buena presentación de su negocio a los clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: papas, cebollas, zanahorias, tomate, repollo, uvas y manzanas con el fin de abastecer  su negocio y ofrecer variedad.
texts.en:
Carmen is originally from the city of Matagalpa. She is 27 years old and is married with 2 children. She has been in business selling fruit and vegetables for 8 years. She started the business with the help of her parents and gradually set up her own business, which has helped her to support her family. She sells her products in the market and is situated in an area visited by a lot of shoppers. She hopes to improve the infrastructure of her stall so she can present her business well to the shoppers.

Carmen is asking for the loan to buy potatoes, onions, carrots, tomatoes, cabbages, grapes and apples so she can stock her business and offer variety.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, carrots, tomatoes, cabbages, grapes and apples.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel es una persona muy trabajadora, que trabaja y lucha por poder salir adelante. Es un ejemplo de lucha y trabajo duro. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y comenta que lo utilizo su crédito para poder comprar bebidas y surtir su negocio.
Hoy el solicita de nuevo un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos como ser comestibles, bebidas, verduras, frutas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y luchando. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Angel is a very hard-working person who strives to be able to get ahead in life. He is an example of hard work and determination. This is his second loan with Kiva and he says he used the first loan to buy drinks and stock his business.

Now he is asking for a loan again which he will use to buy supplies such as food, drinks, fruit, vegetables and other items and thus will be able to carry on working and striving for success. He is grateful for this new opportunity which he is getting.

loans.use: to buy drinks and other supplies.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado divino Niño Jesus está en su ciclo número diez del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están tratando de salir adelante para poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Magdalena,  es vendedora de muebles, y comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia teniendo los ingresos necesarios para el día a día. Ella es una persona con grandes ganas de progresar y ser alguien mejor en la vida. 
La Sra. Magdalena Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Muebles y juguetes de madera en general, para poder venderlos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "divino Niño Jesus"  [divine baby Jesus] is in its tenth cycle of the women's committee programme, in which they are all trying to make progress towards improving their lives. 

One of the members is Magdalena, who sells furniture. She says that through her work she makes enough income to help her family with the daily necessities. She has a great desire to make progress and be a better person in life. 

Magdalena is asking for this loan to buy furniture and mainly wooden toys to sell, which will help her to set up her business plan which in turn will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy furniture and mainly wooden toys.

loans.name: Aniza

texts.ru: Анизе 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Анизы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Аниза занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,500 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 6 овец, а также имеет 1,13 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аниза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Аниза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Aniza is 37 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Aniza has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Aniza practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 13 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 1,500 som (KGS). Thanks to Aniza's hard work, she currently has on her farm: 1 milk cow, 1 calf, 6 sheep, as well as a 1.13 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans and clover every year. Her monthly income is 9,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Aniza turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Aniza plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Fatmata from the Kambia Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, ages 3 and 5.  She began her business at the age of 15 because she wanted to empower herself and improve her family.

Fatmata runs a food stand within her community. She sells rice, onions, tomato paste and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is transporting her goods to the rural village.  

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy, rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education,  Victoria  is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling tiger nuts in Asebu Ekraful  (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Victoria is married and has a number of children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees.  

Victoria wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of tiger nuts. In the long term, Victoria plans to reinvest her future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.
